title: (LEGACY) O&E PRD
content:
Chorus team 
 PM: 

 Design: Envoy

 SAs: TBD

 Timeline 
 Design: TBD

 Dev: TBD

 Jira epic 
 TBD

 Figma file 
 Future state workflow created with county
 Brief version of this workflow created with Design (Mike Squibb & Arron)

 Latest designs 

 Updated Referrals & Linkages Designs presented to County

 Client impacts 

 Client deadline 
 TBD

 About 
 The O&E platform will be expanded to include more robust referrals and linkages management, a dispatch dashboard, and a mobile experience that allows field workers to manage and update their cases in the field.
 Objective
 O&E Admins need the ability to receive referrals

 O&E Admins need the ability to dispatch field workers into the field

 O&E field workers need to:
 Review and capture additional case and client information

 Update their status

 Record outcomes while out on dispatch

 Send referrals 

 O&E field workers need to create cases in the field if they encounter someone who is experiencing homelessness and a mental health need (lower priority for launch)

 Audience
 O&E Admins

 O&E Field Workers

 Critical User Journey

 Requirements
 O&E Admin

 As an O&E Admin, I want the ability to manage incoming referrals 
 Referral Dashboard 
 View all incoming referrals and filter by:
 Participant, SPA, City, Referral Date, Status, Workers
 Ideally users could filter by a field worker and regardless of which number they're assigned (primary field worker, field worker #2, field worker #3, etc.) they would be able to populate in the same repeating section

 The referrals should appear from newest to oldest referrals
 However, Admins want the ability to sort by oldest to newest

 Update manage referrals page to include:
 Referral information and client information 
 There should be two edit buttons - one to edit referral info and one to edit client info

 There should also be the ability to change client and create a new client as needed

 Assignment details and send dispatch button

 Case Status

 Case Outcomes

 O&E Referrals 
 Ability to send a referral to another provider
 Provide list of commonly referred to providers
 This list must be flexible as providers come in and out of the system of care

 Provide access to the full set of providers for users to search for the appropriate provider

 May need to support filters for searching this list of providers - this should ideally be the same list and filters as the OC Navigator

 Create dispatch dashboard
 Needs to include the following data fields:
 Client

 City & SPA

 O&E Field workers assigned

 RP: Reporting Party

 When the status was last updated

 When the referral was received

 Number of attempts someone has made to start the assessment

 This dispatch dashboard needs to be filterable by SPA (e.g., as a Regional Supervisor, I only want to see cases in the North SPA)

 The current CAT Dispatch Dashboard has the activity tracker in the top left corner, I don't think we need this for the O&E Dispatch Dashboard since it's not used that often according to users

 O&E Mobile

 As an O&E field worker, I need the ability to manage and update the cases that are assigned to me. 
 O&E Mobile current designs 
 SMS & Email - Field worker receives text or email informing them that they have a new case
 Field worker has to log in to view case

 Dashboard - Field worker views their assigned cases on a dashboard
 New cases that have not yet been accepted are at the top with the ability to call dispatch if they are not able to accept the case

 Cases they are actively working on are right below new cases

 Details Tab - Field workers can view the details of a case and edit participant information or edit case details
 There should be a warning page after someone attempts to edit a participant and save the changes: "Are you sure you want to make this change?"

 My Progress tab - Field workers can update the status of the case
 Geolocation is needed to get the current location
 Address is preferred over LAT/LONG since it is more easily editable

 Statuses may be attempted multiple times
 Each time a status is attempted, the time and location must be documented

 The number of times a status is attempted needs to be documented

 Activity Tab - provides context on what has happened during a case. The contents of this activity needs to be further defined (e.g., what is included in the activity? Status attempts? Location and time of status attempts?)

 Outcomes tab - Outcomes should be documented at the end of the case with the ability to send referrals
 Provide list of commonly referred to providers
 This list must be flexible as providers come in and out of the system of care

 Provide access to the full set of providers for users to search for the appropriate provider

 May need to support filters for searching this list of providers - this should ideally be the same list and filters as the OC Navigator

 Users also want the ability to print resources on mobile printers in the field

 Create ability to search for team members 

 Create ability to search for resources

 Ability for field workers to flag or notify admins if they believe the wrong client is associated to a case 
 Changing a client on a mobile device may be tricky since it's a more extensive workflow

 Admins need the ability to see these notifications and document when they've been addressed

 Note: In CAT Mobile, users have the option to navigate to a "Cases" page on the primary navigation bar and search through all cases. O&E leadership do not want this as an option to reduce unnecessary PHI

 Create case in O&E Mobile [HOLD on this - this will be future state]

 Provide ability for field workers to create a case in the field

 Data sharing across applications

 [HOLD on this - this will be future state] 
 Create ability for O&E Field workers to access the OC Navigator resource list

 Out of scope
 Share referrals with 1. Regional Contracts & 2. City Specific providers that will not use Chorus (Future State Requirements)

 Files
 Future state workflow created with county 
 Brief version of this workflow created with Design (Mike Squibb & Arron)

 Statuses of the workflow 

 Latest designs 

 Updated Referrals & Linkages Designs presented to County 
 Note: this is a clickable prototype - please reach out if you have questions on how to navigate a prototype in Figma 

 Referrals & Linkages status update for Directors 
 O&E will need to be able to receive and send referrals

 Problems to solve

 Q&A
 Question 
 Answer/notes 
 Team to ask 

 At what point should an O&E referral be considered "linked"?
 Start assessment
 Cons: what if the assessment is not successfully completed because the participant refuses

 End assessment
 Cons: what if the assessment technically "ends" but again the participant has mostly refused

 Separate status for Linked?

 Christina Weckerly

 Can we shadow the O&E workflow in the field?

 May need fields and flags for field workers to record if they tried to connect participants with another provider and there was an issue 
 Internal note: Conversation should be with Christina (not the line staff)
 Christina would know more, but there's been stories of field workers who have connected a client to another provider and the other provider doesn't show or client doesn't want to work with the other provider 

 Different reasons why that connection doesn't work

 O&E has done their job and that lack of connection or linkage is because the provider is not delivering the service or it's the client preference to not receive service from that provider

title: PRD - CRP Bed Board + Referrals & Linkages (R&L)
content:
Chorus team 
 PM: Thai

 Project Manager: Mike

 Design: TBD 

 SAs: Patrick, Dylan

 QA: TBD

 Timeline 
 See project plan 

 Roadmap 
 OC Roadmap: CRP Section 

 Jira epics 
 See section on Critical User Stories and Requirements 

 Figma file 
 CRP Bed Board Designs 

 Client impacts 
 R&L will ultimately affect all OC Products

 Client deadline 
 December 12, 2023

 Before we begin: a note on terminology
 Term 
 Definition 

 CRP (Crisis Residential Program) 
 From HCA website : highly structured, voluntary services in a residential setting for individuals who are experiencing a behavioral health crisis and meet eligibility requirements:
 Individuals ages 12+ can be referred if they have been evaluated for psychiatric hospitalization, can be safely referred to a less restrictive, lower level of care and they and/or their family are experiencing considerable distress

 Individuals must be referred by hospitals (for the Children's and TAY sites), County CAT/PERTs or County or County-contracted Specialty Mental Health Plan programs (i.e., the program does not accept walk-ins, self-referrals)

 The Adult CRS program currently has 42 beds available at 4 sites located throughout Orange County

 Crisis Stabilization Units (CSUs) 
 From HCA website : 24-hour, 7-day a week, year-round service for individuals who are experiencing a behavioral health crisis requiring emergent stabilization that cannot wait until a regularly scheduled appointment
 Notes from Addie: 
 These are typically involuntary stays for individuals who are a danger to self (DTS), danger to others (DTO), or gravely disabled (GD)

 They are at most 23 hour 59 min stays

 CSUs currently use Chorus. CRPs do not use Chorus yet. We're building CRPs and then going to update CSUs to be consistent

 Bed Board (aka Bed Availability Board) 
 Shows availability at different programs, so that referrers (e.g., Police, CAT Team, etc.) know if they can refer a client to a program

 Referral 
 When a client is given a recommendation in writing to a specific service provider for care and treatment

 Linkage 
 Client participates at least once in the treatment to which they were referred. Since CRPs are residential stays, "Linkage" has been defined as when the client is admitted to the service

 Closed Loop Referral 
 Referring and receiving providers are able to track the status of a referral and confirm client status between both providers

 Pods 
 Group of bedrooms that share the same bathroom and can only be used for a single gender (adult) or sex assigned at birth (children). Almost all bedrooms at CRPs are dual occupancy, so in some cases a pod will only be for one room (or two beds), in other cases a pod will be for multiple bedrooms. These pods can be flipped from being a female room to a male room based on need

 Problem statement
 The focus of this initiative is aimed at CRP Supervisors, Clinicians, and associated management users, targeting several key challenges they currently encounter:
 CRPs in Orange County struggle with the manual and time-consuming task of answering numerous phone calls from CSUs, CAT, law enforcement, hospitals, etc. checking for available beds. This process wastes staff time, risks miscommunication, and delays placements. To streamline this, a solution is needed to display real-time bed availability for CRPs, enabling quicker and more informed decisions for referral

 The current referral process lacks a streamlined and efficient system for sending and receiving referrals across different OC programs. This results in communication gaps and delays in placing individuals in suitable CRPs

 There is a lack of visibility regarding bed availability across the 8 OC CRPs, leading to a lack of visibility from leadership and also on care coordination between CRPs. For example, referrals could be sent to multiple CRPs leading to duplicative work and confusion

 Overall, there is a pressing need for a comprehensive referral management system that enables OC CRPs to efficiently process incoming referrals, monitor outgoing referrals, and gain insights into bed availability. This system should bridge the communication gaps, provide the necessary flexibility for different program types, and offer a unified platform to enhance the referral coordination process among OC CRPs.
 Objective
 Create a system that allows OC CRPs to receive, manage, and send referrals to other OC programs (both county contracted and county operated). This includes the ability to: 
 Receive and manage incoming referrals

 Send and track outgoing referrals

 View bed availability across the 8 OC CRPs:
 Adult CRPs: Coastal Star, Treehouse North [Silver], Treehouse South, Exodus
 Adult CRPs should be able to see bed availability cards for Adult and TAY 

 TAY CRPs: Waymakers TAY
 TAY CRPs should be able to see bed availability cards for all CRPs

 Childrens CRPs: Waymakers Tustin, Waymakers Huntington Beach, Waymakers Laguna Beach
 Childrens CRPs should be able to bed availability cards for Children CRPs and TAY 

 Broader Context
 CRPs will be the first program to include the Referrals & Linkages (R&L) module (a module designed to send and receive referrals digitally across the county)
 At first, since they will be the only program, they will only be able to document the referrals they send and receive

 However as additional programs are onboarded onto the R&L module, CRPs will be able to digitally send and receive referrals through Chorus 

 Sharon would like the initial focus of R&L to be on the crisis system of care which includes: 
 CRPs (new system) - 1st R&L program 

 CSUs - 2nd R&L program (already built, but will need to be updated to be consistent with the CRP experience including adding the R&L module)

 CAT - 3rd R&L program (already built, but need to add R&L module)

 OC Links - 4th R&L program (already built, but need to add R&L module)

 IHCS (new system) (Dec 2024 update, IHCS has not been added) 

 O&E (new mobile dispatch system) - Led in a separate initiative by JJ that will include the R&L module to reduce any retrofits down the road

 Personas
 CRP Supervisor (Maria) 
 Goals: Maria wants to be able to care for her client and quickly view and manage all the referrals

 Motivations: Maria really cares about her clients and wants to make sure that they're efficiently and effectively admitted into her CRP

 Frustrations: Maria is frustrated that staff at CRPs spend so much time manually updating others on bed availability and entering in referral info. She also finds it difficult to report out to the county on referrals and linkages

 Clinician at TREEHouse North CRP (Leon) 
 Goals: Leon wants to be able to care for his client and help clients find ongoing care after their stay at TREEHouse North CRP

 Motivations: Leon really wants to set up a care path for his clients so they can continue their treatment after they leave

 Frustrations: Leon is frustrated when he spends so much time on administrative tasks and can't quickly find information that could help his client

 Client at TREEHouse North CRP - note: clients will not have access to the CRP Bed board in the short term (Richard) 
 Goals: Richard wants to work on his mental health by staying at TREEHouse North

 Motivations: Richard wants to get help with his anxiety and be able to have a plan of action after his stay at TREEHouse North

 Frustrations: Richard is frustrated by having to retell his story to different programs in the county. He's also frustrated that the process takes such a long time

 User Research Synthesis
 In person shadowing

 Ongoing design reviews and program check-ins

 Shadowing Docs
 CRPs 

 User Journey for CRPs 

 CSUs 

 Notable quotes:
 "The biggest pain-point is starting an intake process for a patient, and finding out that another facility admitted them. This wastes time, already takes a long time…" 

 "Would be helpful to track data in one place" 

 Functional Workflow 
 https://www.figma.com/board/ONkGVhwGwRCB2XWIi90JP3/CRP%2FCSU-Generalized-workflow?node-id=5-150&t=om1D1dk9mbGDKdkq-4 Success metrics
 Goal 
 Metric 

 Capture key data points in the R&L workflow that is required for state reporting
 From the time that the first referral was sent for a client:
 How long does it take for a referral to be accepted?

 How long does it take for a referral to be linked? 

 Reduce the burden of phone calls and data entry by:
 Displaying bed availability

 Sending referrals from one program to another

 Staff satisfaction 

 80% faster than traditional referral processes
 Provide bed availability over the phone or through email

 Review a referral

 Send a referral

 Follow up on a referral

 Track the percentage of successful linkages to care over time

 Onboard additional programs to Chorus to facilitate easy referrals
 8 additional programs on Chorus by EOY

 Referral response rate
 50% of automated referrals responded to within 30 minutes

 Future Roadmap (currently out of scope for initial launch)
 Feature 
 Justification 

 Support for outgoing referrals to mental health clinics and SUD 
 Requires SUD and Mental health clinics to use Chorus systems. Target Date: Q2 2025

 Integrated referrals and bedboards viewable directly on OC links, O&E, and CAT
 Requries bed availability to be moved to the OC Data Nexus. There are also dependencies for updates need to be made on OC links, O&E, and CAT.

 Administrative/supervisor views
 Adds ability to oversee multiple programs, merge clients, and general stats for referral reporting

 Ability to revert statuses
 Pivot from "reverting" status to re-forwarding a referral even when it's not assigned to you

 Launch Artifacts (archived)
 Permissions
 See ticket for rules: CP-4982 a9d3eb4c-c63a-3c77-864c-b5dd8664a020 System Jira 
 Critical User Journeys & Requirements
 See Q4 Product Plan for high-level requirements
 https://docs.google.com/document/d/1_gXk4ybpvtzTAQ8TLvD9MuQJhgkOXULGm_-SKvkQyF8/edit 
 Dependencies
 Data Type 
 Action 
 Status 

 Foundational 
 Data Sharing Among Apps - Platform feature that will allow apps within Chorus to share a variable with another app
 CHORUS-2526 a9d3eb4c-c63a-3c77-864c-b5dd8664a020 System Jira 

 Forecasted live feature is [COMPLETE] 

 SSO - Platform feature that will allow users to log in through OC's Azure SSO
 Pending OC approval for SSO Roll Out in OC Links apps first. 
 CRP SSO to follow soon after. 

 Client 
 Client History - Determine the minimum viable history that all programs will be able to view
 Blocker : IT & Compliance sign off required before turning on automated referrals among OC apps
 Required Milestone Meetings: 
 Requirements meeting with Sharon & Tim ( Sarah to coordinate scheduling)

 OC IT, Compliance, and Sharon for MHP & DMC client data sharing requirements is being rescheduled.

 Client data - Determine the demographic data, ssn, etc.
 Confirm with team: We may need to proceed with the existing OC data fields for CRP. It may not be possible to update the OC Links data fields and move them to a separate app before October
 Finalized demographic descriptors from county [COMPLETE] 

 Determine if we're using the current OC Links, CAT, O&E client fields or updated fields to be more aligned with PIF [COMPLETE] 

 Modify PIF Form Design to be applied to CRP design [COMPLETE] 

 Addie to review forms one last time for accuracy [COMPLETE] 

 Final fields & variable implications across projects documented here 

 Chorus Master Client Index Development and Implementation - 
 Chorus Master Client Index (MCI) will be configured within its own Chorus app, allowing program apps the ability to read and write client data and history to a single source of truth

 New apps (CRP) will have the option to be built and connected to the MCI during development. Live apps will need to be refactored to connect them to the MCI (CAT, OC Links, O&E)

 CP-3977 a9d3eb4c-c63a-3c77-864c-b5dd8664a020 System Jira with progress and stories for each app to be connected to MCI

 Next Steps:
 Designs for resource page with updated fields
 (in progress, completion forecast )

 Connect CRP to Chorus MCI 
 likely during sprint 9

 Referral 
 Outgoing referrals - Top 10 List 
 Addie to ask each CRP to:
 Identify in the OC Nav the top 10 resources that they refer out to, so that we can try to pin them to the top of their search list (like we do for OC Links)

 If they refer out to a program that is not in the OC Navigator, to can let us know and we can look into adding it

 Update 10/06: Relevant Resource List no longer in scope for MVP due to resource bias concerns from county 
 Requested from CRP stakeholders with requested due date of [COMPLETE] 

 Outgoing referrals - Referral groups 
 For outgoing referrals, we will want programs to be able to send referrals to a referral group or an individual program within a referral group 
 Individual program: refer to an individual CRP (e.g., previously worked with a CRP, hospital reached out to a CRP directly, etc.)

 Referral group: refer to the Youth CRP Group and the Adult CRP Group, so that multiple programs have the chance to claim a referral

 Action: Therefore, there needs to be two resources added to outgoing referrals:
 Youth CRP Referral Group

 Adult CRP Referral Group

 Forecast to be complete and ready to connect to CRP build by 

 For incoming referrals, we will want programs to be able to select a referral source that is not currently in the OC Navigator
 Can/should we add incoming sources on the PEI Incoming Referral Form not in the OC Navigator? 

 OC Navigator resource database clean up
 In progress:
 Referral Resource Database to be updated by 

 R&L Data Architecture
 Please click here to view data architecture needs: R&L Data Architecture . This includes: 
 Client and referral data
 OC Links, CAT, O&E, CRP, CSU all share the same client list but OC Warmline and PEI do not

 Resource data

 Statuses

 Files
 Other Bed Boards:
 Chorus NHF Bed Board 

 LA Service and Bed Availability Tools 

 Shadowing Docs
 CRPs 

 User Journey for CRPs 

 CSUs 

 Data architecture 

 Notes doc 

 OC Cares Presentation (reviewing R&L in a broader context)

 Open Questions for CRP
 Question 
 Answer 
 Team to ask 

 Can we have one client list across all programs?
 If the program has access to search all clients in IRIS, then they should be able to search all clients in Chorus.
 We heard that CRPs (TREEHouse North) have limited access to the EHR. Who can we follow up to validate that this works? 
 Sharon

 How should we handle user management for county contracted agencies? Especially CRPs 
 Sharon

 Do programs send referrals to all CRPs or do they send referrals to Youth CRPs and Adult CRPs?
 TAY referrals (client 18-25 yrs) are sent to TAY CRP first, if they are not able to accommodate, then the referral is sent to Adult CRP for services. 
 Youth referrals ((18 and under) are sent to Children's CRP specifically. 
 Matthew / Amy / Seneca

 Duplicate clients are likely to grow as we add programs. We don't want the burden to fall on OC Links and CAT. Do you have any suggestions on who could help merge clients? How does this work in IRIS?
 Sharon

 How much client history should we show for CRPs? OC Links? CSU? O&E? etc? Note: Amy's perspective (Erika was on the call) was to not show anything beyond CRP because she didn't want to create biases if someone had a lot of experience with O&E or CSU
 *Sharon's feedback was that if the programs are currently able to see mental health and/or SUD history currently, then the same permissions should remain true within the R&L module. 

 Open Questions for Referrals & Linkages Beyond CRP
 Question 
 Answer 
 Team to ask 

 OC Links - Does OC Links receive referrals from other programs? Do they need an incoming referrals table (this could be similar to their chat page)

 Relevant resources for each program
 Here is Coastal Star's list:
 County outpatient (not separated by which location)

 Open Access

 PACT

 PCP

title: OC Warmline RingCentral/NICE Integration PRD
content:
Disclaimer : See also RingCentral (Nice in Contact) + Chorus API Integration PRD for the generic integration of RingCentral to Chorus created. The document below is tailored to the OC Warmline use case and how it fits into the larger project of building an improved case creation workflow.
 11/7 update : We are exploring a different approach for this integration (i.e. NICE screen pop versus API) and will continue updating this document as needed.
 1 6 false list false Chorus team 
 PM: Mayra

 Project Manager: Mike V.

 Design: Ellie

 SAs: Christy Lee (lead), Eric, Gio, 

 QA: Jason, Kayla

 Timeline 
 Note: As of 11/7, all dates are tentative as we are assessing approach and next steps (API versus screen pop) 
 SA build 
 v1 handoff to client: 12/18 ( see OC forecast dates )

 Engineering 
 Build 
 Begins: 10/23 

 Ends (TBD) 12/14 

 E2E 
 Begins: 12/18

 Ends: 12/28

 UAT begins: 
 Begins: 01/02

 Ends: 01/12

 Training 
 Begins: 01/15

 Ends: 01/25

 Jira Product Discovery 
 OC Project > Warmline 

 Figma file 
 RC designs 

 Client impacts & metrics 
 OC Warmline
 Total staff: Scaling up to 150, starting on July 1, 2023 
 Staff per shift: 22; 15 taking calls 
 Call volume: 10k/mo

 Client deadline 
 Q1 2024

 Problem statement
 The focus of this initiative is targeted at OC Warmline staff, which includes administrators, supervisors, mentors, and volunteers. Currently, the staff use two disparate systems (see current state workflow below) to handle repetitive tasks when consumers aka "participants" are calling in for assistance. 
 Before starting a new case, the dedicated Warmline team goes through the tedious process of manually transferring phone numbers from their RingCentral/NICE phone service to a case management system ( currently iCarol - which will be replaced by Chorus' proprietary web app ). This step is crucial for connecting these numbers to valued participant profiles or determining if new profiles should be created. Unfortunately, this process causes frustration for the hardworking Warmline staff, and it diverges from their ideal case workflow. We are committed to enhancing our support system to make this experience smoother and more aligned with our team's preferences.
 Goal 
 Eliminate manual step(s) to transfer participant phone numbers from RingCentral/ NICE contact center into the new OC Warmline chorus application. 

 Increase customer satisfaction (both Warmline user as well as participant experience) by reducing the amount of time needed to attend to the participant and create a new case.

 User Personas 
 Lisa: Administrative Supervisor 
 Goals : Lisa aims to streamline operations and optimize the efficiency of OC Warmline staff, ensuring quicker identification of callers within Chorus, thereby enabling faster delivery of emotional support services.

 Motivations : Lisa is driven by her commitment to empowering her team's performance and accelerating the provision of timely assistance to OC residents. She also seeks the capability to quantifiably measure achievements and provide comprehensive reports to stakeholders in the County.

 Frustrations : Lisa is notably frustrated by the existing manual processes between RingCentral and the case management system. This bottleneck hampers her staff's ability to promptly access participant profiles, including critical case history and referral details, hindering the amount of time staff spend providing emotional support.

 Andy: Warmline Mentor 
 Goals : Andy is dedicated to offering immediate and meaningful assistance to participants reaching out to the Warmline during his shifts.

 Motivations : Driven by genuine compassion for making a difference, Andy recognizes the significant role he and his colleagues play in providing essential emotional support to Warmline participants. He embraces the responsibility of being a dependable listener, particularly for those who lack other avenues for communication.

 Frustrations : Andy is notably disheartened by the current process of having to navigate between two separate platforms to access phone numbers and participant information. He believes this valuable time could be better spent directly aiding individuals in need, aligning with the Warmline's core mission.

 Proposed Solution (See future state flow below) 
 Integrate the new Chorus OC Warmline case management system with RingCentral/NICE contact center phone provider to: 
 Allow staff to view the inbound phone number (auto-populated) without having to manually copy and paste from a different system; 

 Automatically lookup/load participant information if already exists in the case management DB; 

 If the phone number does not match an existing profile, allow staff to create a new participant profile.

 Critical User Journey
 User: Warmline staff 
 Current state 
 Future state 
 Assumptions
 Warmline staff will start in a net new case management system within Chorus creating new case records going forward. 

 Warmline will continue to have access to participant case history in iCarol. 

 Key User Stories and Project Updates
 7/18 updates: 
 Tested with RC now that Chorus staff have Azure accounts. The test mostly passed, but when the phone passes, the search isn't being automatically triggered. 

 Recent change was that RC introduced country code to match updated Chorus requirements. and Jamie will work with SAs to investigate. 

 3/27 updates: 
 Sanjiv looking into the issue will be joining the 3/28 weekly check-in with the client and Jenny to test again

 3/20 updates: 
 Tested the 3/23 Eng fix CHORUS-6127 a9d3eb4c-c63a-3c77-864c-b5dd8664a020 System Jira with a Warmline staff ( ticket here ) and included the RingCentral vendor and primary stakeholder during the call as well, and unfortunately, the issue was not resolved. The user was still routed to the dashboard.
 Next steps

 Mike and Mayra and to work with Sanjiv to outline next steps and a possible timeline to complete additional troubleshooting/testing. Might also need OC IT for any Azure/SSO dependencies. The vendor would really like us to provide a general timeframe and we stressed we can't know until we investigate the root cause.

 Mayra to update emails going out next week so that staff are aware that RC will not be included as part of the April 1 launch; we have been communicating that outstanding issues were being tested this week and we'd know if it could be included in the launch.

 Next steps:

 Asking RC to grant Warmline staff access to RC/Nice test account so they can test with OC IT's SSO and multi-factor setup; Lisbeth to share who she would like to participate in testing 
 Test steps here

 1/9 updates:

 Outstanding issue: Users are prompted to log in to Chorus once the Chorus tab launches, even though they're already logged in. Will escalate to Engineering. 

 1/2 updates: 
 See Ring Central/NICE testing notes and steps 
 Action items: Mayra provided w/test account; Raghu is preparing test script to make test calls and will send when ready. 

 11/30 updates: FYI
 RingCentral is in the midst of UAT for the call center which will be going live on 12/05 . Below are some notes that pertain to our team:
 Raghu shared that when he uses the screen pop, it forces him to log back into the system. Once he logs back in, it brings him to the create a case page.
 Follow-up notes: 
 Asked Raghu to send screen share of what he's seeing so we can validate issue.

 Possible workarounds to discuss internally to prevent staff from having to log in when closing browser window (Note: Warmline has shared that all staff use Chrome on PCs; Chrome seems to delete session cookie, but Safari does not):
 Train staff to keep browser window open when taking calls from RC/NICE and creating cases in Chorus. 

 Discuss with Eng if there is an option to set longer term session with an expiry code encoded, for the Warmline only. However, this may lead to other issues if staff do want the browser to log them out upon closing. 

 Research other options.
 Server-side session management to extend session durations; keep-alive mechanisms; user activity tracking; persistent cookies; custom session handling; adjust client-side settings; implement idle timeout
 For all of these, consider security implications as longer durations might increase risk of unauthorized access if session is hijacked

 He also mentioned that he will need a participant profile phone number that exists in the Warmline system that he can use for testing too.
 Follow up notes: Shared test account with Raghu 123-456-7890 

 Prem shared that they'll be able to work more with us after the call center and holidays . He spoke with Stephanie about this a week ago or so too.

 Raghu is passing the phone to the URLs and will keep us posted on testing

 11/9 updates: 
 Will ask RC/NICE to send phone numbers in the following format: XXXXXXXXXX
 11/14 response from RC/NICE: Yes, we can send the below format from CXONE to Chorus. Format: XXXXXXXXXX 

 We can programmatically enter the + in the URL

 We can reformat the text fields to phone once Eng addresses the following issue (tentatively week of 11/29): CHORUS-5849 a9d3eb4c-c63a-3c77-864c-b5dd8664a020 System Jira 

 Priority 
 User story 

 1

 11/27 updates: 
 URLs ready for RC testing:
 Existing profile with phone number: https://chorusplatform.io/m/oc-warmline/rc?phone=234567890 

 Phone number not in the system: https://chorusplatform.io/m/oc-warmline/rc?phone=234567777 

 2
 CP-3909 a9d3eb4c-c63a-3c77-864c-b5dd8664a020 System Jira 

 TBD if needed

 Success metrics
 Goal 
 Metric 

 Improve case workflow by removing burden of having to copy and paste phone number from RingCentral into Chorus to view participant profile and case history. 
 Gather staff feedback and assess satisfaction with integration. 
 Did we help reduce inefficiencies? 

 Milestones 
 Milestone 1: Integration Discovery
 Milestone 2: Design
 Milestone 3: Development
 Milestone 4: Testing
 Milestone 5: UAT
 Milestone 6: Release

 Release Blockers: 
 If there are any security, integration, or compliance issues. 

 Release Blockers: 
 If the design leads to a user experience that is hard to navigate.

 Release Blockers: 
 API issues or various other integration/compatibility issues with Chorus.

 Release Blockers: 
 Identification of issues that compromise security, functionality, or performance of the integration. 

 Release Blockers: 
 Any user feedback from testing that identifies any bugs or critical issues.

 Release Blockers: 
 Any issues that arose from internal testing or UAT that would compromise the functioning integration of RingCentral, operational workflows of the Warmline staff, and synchronization of data. 

 Must have: 
 A basic understanding of the technical needs for data sharing and APIs between Chorus and RingCentral. 

 Understanding of the design requirements needed for RingCentral to integrated into the Chorus platform. 

 Must have: 
 The RingCentral integration design should be easy to navigate. 

 Design should include showing participant information displays (includes demographic) 

 Design should include showing who the participant has talked to today 

 Design should include showing how many times the participant has called today/how recently 

 Must have: 
 Functioning integration of RingCentral (NICE inContact) with the Chorus platform. 

 Associate calls/phone numbers with new and existing cases in the Warmline system.

 Synchronization of staff and contractor RingCentral accounts and Chorus accounts. 

 Displays participant information displays (includes demographic) 

 Displays who the participant has talked to today 

 Displays how many times the participant has called today/how recently

 Must have: 
 Verification that the interface operates smoothly and that calls are being logged and matched to profiles correctly.

 Verification that the following information is displayed: 
 Participant information displays (includes demographic) 

 Who the participant has talked to today 

 How many times the participant has called today/how recently

 Must have: 
 Positive feedback on the design and build of the RingCentral integration. Would like to see if this enhances their workflow and daily operations as intended. 

 Must have: 
 Successful release of the integration that results in a smooth user platform, accurate call logging and overall functionality of the platform for the Warmline staff. 

 Nice to have: 
 Nice to have: 
 Design of any additional features outside of basic integration.

 Nice to have: 
 Nice to have: 
 Nice to have: 
 Positive user feedback on all test plans.

 Nice to have: 

 Future phases
 Out of scope
 Staff pick up the call via a RingCentral widget that pops up in Chorus (in-app dial screen).
 If staff set themselves to available, the widget is automatically opens on their screen. 

 If staff do not set themselves to take calls or work on follow ups (not available), then they open the widget and dial out. 

 Data dashboards for any metrics. Chorus will provide raw data to the Warmline/County. 

 RingCentral metrics/dashboards within Chorus. 

 Files or references
 See RingCentral (Nice in Contact) + Chorus API Integration PRD for technical information. 
 Problems to solve
 Schedule technical discussion once contract is finalized between OC Warmline and RingCentral. The Warmline staff will facilitate in scheduling this discussion. 

 Decisions
 11/2 - Let's pursue the NICE screen pop approach versus the NICE API as this will lead to a better user experience by sending data faster to Chorus; API might lead to delays, which will cause user frustration when trying to create cases quickly. 
 See meeting notes from design review and discussion . 

 Open questions 
 Question 
 Answer 
 Team to ask 

 See RingCentral (Nice in Contact) + Chorus API Integration PRD for additional technical questions.

 Do phone calls ever get transferred?
 Yes, phone calls can get transferred to supervisors if a participant is abusive or inappropriate with the staff.

 Which platform will be responsible for reporting answered and unanswered calls?
 RingCentral will be responsible for this.

 We need to be able to be able to display more than one phone number for each participant; right now, we only have one phone field per participant. 
 Status: Created new corresponding story. 

 We are having discussions with the Warmline about removing the Caller section and fields as it's not as common for someone else to call on the behalf of a participant. 
 The Warmline confirmed that this does not happen very often. The decision is to have the field be optional for them to fill out.

 11/2 - Any concerns with integrating via the NICE screen pop approach ( PopURL )? Let's discuss with RingCentral on 11/7 with Preston joining the Warmline/RC implementation call. 
 11/7 notes and action items: 
 No, let's proceed and complete the following:
 Send RC/NICE @Raghu M URL 
 Once we've done the configuration on our side with our SAs to place the URL in the browser, send them the URL to test

 Create test account for @Raghu M 

 Coordinate with Lisbeth to walk us through the current RC/NICE setup/build since they're already in UAT. 

 Work with SAs to get this in before Warmline begins to UAT what we've built. 
 Mayra and Katy will discuss tasks/next steps on 11/7 at 4:30
 Created new ticket for SAs to set up; shared with Christy Forte and Christy Lee; meeting on 11/8 to discuss questions and whether we can add to sprint 10 (in progress)

 Only issue might be if we do want to provide call history log in Chorus; let's review the RC/Nice integration and gather any additional requirements. In the past, Warmline expressed that a call log/history in Chorus would be duplicative of a call log in RingCentral/NICE.

 11/2 - How does Warmline handle chats? Is an agent handling chats and calls at the same time? 
 11/7 notes and action items:
 Participant chats are handled in iCarol, using a Warmline local number. 
 Internal staff chats are handled in RingCentral.
 Are the peer support specialists taking chats and calls? 
 Shift supervisors and peer support specialists are taking:
 One call at time

 One chat at a time 

 In RC, peer support specialists set themselves to "do not disturb" when taking chats 
 In the future, explore automatically setting "do not disturb" once staff claim a chat in Chorus and then setting back to available after the chat has been closed

 Once we are ready to port over the participant chat phone to Chorus, let's keep in mind that Twilio might take weeks to do this. 

 11/2 - What happens if staff are logged in to NICE but are not logged in to Chorus? Let's think through this workflow.

 11/2 - What happens if they close the browser? How do they recover? 
 In NICE would they reopen the screen pop?

 We could associate the call ID/event with the logs 

 Might be just an edge case but we can explore

title: CSU Shadowing
content:
Objectives
 Shadow administrators and clinicians while they are using Chorus and other systems to understand how data is being entered across tools

 Better understand how users are interacting with Chorus to find areas of opportunity

 Learn how CSU employees receive and send referrals as we look to develop this capability in Chorus

 Important note: this research will only ever be used internally to guide product design only with this product team, we will never share data and will always keep data private

 Agenda
 Shadow a variety of employees (ideally both Administrators and Clinicians) from 10am-2pm on June 2nd 

 Where it is appropriate and not disruptive, ask questions to staff about their workflow and experience using Chorus

 Questions
 Can I see how you typically use Chorus? 
 What do you like?

 What do you dislike?

 How often do you use the Live Bed Board Tab? Under Review Tab? All Tab?

 How do you send referrals?
 What information do you send?

 Do you receive confirmation that a referral has been accepted? Linked?

 How do you receive referrals?
 What information do you receive?

 Do you send confirmation that a referral has been accepted? Linked?

 What other systems are you currently entering client data into?
 Where is the information you're entering duplicative?

 Would it be helpful to see client history?

 Any feedback on the statuses or reasons? 

 Any additional information that you would like to record in Chorus? 
 Any information that you would like to not have to record in Chorus?

 Helpful Tips While Shadowing
 Meet with a supervisor or manager, etc as a team first when you arrive
 Introduce yourselves

 Reiterate expectations (how long you'll be there, what you're looking for, etc)

 Get tips on how to participate w/o getting in the way

 Divide and conquer so we can get more data back. I'd have each of you shadow individually, and try to shadow as many as you can. An ideal data set would be 5+ people. If we can shadow 5+ people and observe 10-20 use cases, that would be amazing (not sure how long a 'case' will last, but you get the idea: more is better).

 Ask the person you're shadowing to think out loud (when appropriate) to talk through what they're feeling, what they need, what they dislike, what they like. (as long as it doesn't interfere or diminish the experience/task they're working on). If it's not appropriate to verbalize thinking while with a client, quickly chat for a few mins between client interactions to capture what they were thinking

 Notes
 Shadow Person 1
 Client 1

 Client 2

 Client 3

 Shadow Person 2
 Client 1

 Client 2

 Client 3

 Shadow Person 3
 Client 1

 Client 2

 Client 3

 Findings
 Notes from Mike Squibb: 
 If possible, get together right after the research ends and discuss high level findings while it's all fresh in your mind.

 Synthesize findings asap after (the next day, for example) so you can create a user journey (or journeys) and plot out where there's friction, needs, pain points, wins, etc.

title: Scheduling PRD
content:
üëÄ Summary
 Why are we doing this? 
 Our goal is to build a scheduling system that can apply to a wide range of clients. 

 Why is it important? 
 Scheduling will be an integral part of Chorus' offerings and will be flexible enough to apply to an array of clients, both within OCHCA and portfolio clients.

 üìá Contents

 Objective
 This scheduling system will be used for:

 Clinicians at CAT Adult (dispatching required)

 Clinicians at CAT Youth (dispatching required)

 Scheduling will allow OC HCA service chiefs to determine needs or gaps in coverage. It will allow staff members to view and manage their schedule, and clinicians in the field to see where they are in the dispatch order.

 Key User Stories
 As an OC Links Administrator, I can create daily, weekly, and monthly schedules for my staff so that I can manage coverage for all shifts.

 As an OC Links Navigator, I can view my schedule & my colleagues' schedule so that I know my shifts and who I will be working with.

 Critical User Journey(s)
 Admin (Scheduler)
 An Admin creates the schedule, edits the schedules, and adds and removes shifts.

 Staff Member (Navigator, Clinician, Dispatcher, etc.)
 A staff member will be a viewer of the schedule and have the option to view monthly or weekly views, as well as their shifts, other shifts, and open shifts.

 Dispatcher (CAT Youth & Adult only)
 A dispatcher will be updating the dispatch order and providing notes as needed.

 Success metrics

title: CAT Shadowing
content:
Objectives
 Shadow clinicians while they are using Chorus to understand pain points and areas of opportunity

 Understand the key E2E flow(s) (which include, but aren't limited to the tool's use; this is to understand the larger context… the holistic service they provide)

 Better understand known pain points:
 Data crossing

 Missing information in a dispatch

 Notification issues

 Agenda
 Unrelated to shadowing, but the Qualtrix demo will go from 9:30am-11:30am in Santa Ana

 Shadowing will start at 1pm. Location TBD

 Questions
 Understand their workflows, focusing on: 
 How they are using our tool?

 Areas of opportunity (e.g., workarounds, going between pages, taking notes on the side)?
 What do you dislike?

 Areas that are helpful?
 What do you like?

 What should we prioritize improving?

 Where/when on the app (both CAT and OC Links) are you seeing missing data?

 Where/when do you see data crossing?

 Where/when do you see notification issues?

 How is new Clinician onboarding onto Chorus?

 Time permitting: 
 How do you send referrals?
 What information do you send?

 Do you receive confirmation that a referral has been accepted? Linked?

 What other systems are you currently entering client data into?
 Where is the information you're entering duplicative?

 Helpful Tips While Shadowing
 Meet with a supervisor or manager, etc as a team first when you arrive
 Introduce yourselves

 Reiterate expectations (how long you'll be there, what you're looking for, etc)

 Get tips on how to participate w/o getting in the way

 Divide and conquer so we can get more data back. I'd have each of you shadow individually, and try to shadow as many as you can. An ideal data set would be 5+ people. If we can shadow 5+ people and observe 10-20 use cases, that would be amazing (not sure how long a 'case' will last, but you get the idea: more is better).
 Due to safety and the nature of the situation, we will not be dividing and conquering and will likely only be shadowing one person 

 Ask the person you're shadowing to think out loud (when appropriate) to talk through what they're feeling, what they need, what they dislike, what they like. (as long as it doesn't interfere or diminish the experience/task they're working on). If it's not appropriate to verbalize thinking while with a client, quickly chat for a few mins between client interactions to capture what they were thinking

 Note: Where it is appropriate and not disruptive, ask questions to staff about their workflow and experience using Chorus

 Notes
 Shadow Person 1
 Client 1

 Client 2

 Client 3

 Findings
 Notes from Mike Squibb: 
 If possible, get together right after the research ends and discuss high level findings while it's all fresh in your mind.

 Synthesize findings asap after (the next day, for example) so you can create a user journey (or journeys) and plot out where there's friction, needs, pain points, wins, etc.

title: O&E Expansion PRD
content:
üìá Contents
 6 1 false Summary|Contents|Quick reference list false Quick reference
 Chorus team 
 PM: Julie J. ü§ì
 PjM: Sarah üëë
 SA: Christy L., Donovan, Christina üí™
 Design: Ellie üé®
 QA: TBD

 Customer impacts 
 O&E Admins

 O&E Field Workers

 Customer deadline 
 December 2023

 Problem
 Lack of Integration and Efficiency in Referrals and Dispatch 
The current system for managing referrals and dispatches in O&E is fragmented, with limited integration among various providers and programs. This results in delays, missed information, and inconsistencies in care coordination, making it difficult for administrators to ensure that participants receive timely and appropriate care.

 Limited Tools for Field Workers and Real-Time Case Management 
O&E outreach workers currently rely on paper notes and limited mobile access, which hinders their ability to manage cases in real time. Without mobile tools, workers risk losing critical information and struggle to keep up with case updates, impacting both their effectiveness and the quality of care provided to participants. 

 Challenges with Tracking Client Outcomes and Care Progress 
The existing workflow for documenting participant interactions, outcomes, and care progress is inefficient and lacks transparency. Administrators face difficulty tracking field workers' activities, monitoring case statuses, and ensuring follow-ups. This lack of visibility makes it challenging to maintain consistent quality and support across various service areas, often resulting in gaps in client care and missed opportunities for timely interventions.

 Difficulty in Accessing Comprehensive Participant Information 
O&E administrators and outreach workers have limited access to participants' complete profiles and histories across the different programs they interact with, leading to duplicated data entry and potentially incomplete records. This limitation makes it harder to coordinate whole-person care, as workers need to repeatedly ask participants for the same information and face challenges when connecting participants to multiple resources.

 Need for Data-Driven Insights and Quality Improvements 
The current system lacks advanced data tracking and analytics capabilities, making it difficult for O&E to assess program effectiveness and drive improvements. The inability to collect and analyze data across all phases of a participant's journey‚Äîfrom referral to service outcomes‚Äîrestricts the program's ability to make informed decisions for quality improvement and population health management.

 üó£Ô∏è Terminology
 You know what would be helpful when reading this doc? To know what all the words mean.
 Term/Abbreviation 
 Explanation 

 O&E (Outreach & Engagement) 
 From OC HCA : The Orange County Outreach & Engagement (OC O&E) program serves individuals experiencing unsheltered homelessness in Orange County. The program's services focus on linking individuals to needed housing, physical health, behavioral health, and other supportive services by addressing their barriers to care. This is accomplished through developing and building trusting relationships with the homeless community and collaborating with other service providers. Our multi-disciplinary team is proud to provide compassionate, client-centered, and consistent care to meet the needs of the most underserved people in our community. 

 Participant 
 It's important to note that the O&E program refers to people receiving care as "participant," not "client" as with other programs.

 Administrator 
 Sometimes referred to as "Officer of the Day" (OD) or "Regional Supervisor." Whatever the name, these are the folks that are managing cases and workers from an office.

 Outreach worker 
 Sometimes referred to as "field worker," and in other programs, often referred to as "clinicians." These folks are licensed clinical social workers who are out in the community and providing aid to participants.

 Referral 
 When a participant is given a recommendation in writing from another program to receive aid from O&E.

 SPA 
 Acronym for "Service Provider Area," which divides the county into 3 manageable sections:
 North

 Central 

 South

 Objective
 Create a system for O&E to receive, send, and manage referrals, track and manage dispatches, and create a mobile solution for outreach workers in the field. 
 üåé Broader Context
 Our goal is to better integrate O&E with OC Links, CAT and Referrals & Linkages . This expansion will create a unified experience between Chorus apps being used by OC HCA.
 Key components of this system are: 
 Desktop Administrator Functionalities
 Incoming Referrals Dashboard

 Manage Referral page

 Outgoing Referrals Dashboard

 Dispatch Dashboard

 Mobile Outreach Worker Functionalities
 SMS & Email Notifications

 Assigned Cases Dashboard

 Details tab

 My cases

 My Progress tab

 Activity tab

 Outcomes tab
 Access to OC Nav resources

 Create a new case* 
 *Future State ‚Äì currently out of scope 

 User Research Synthesis
 In person shadowing
 2 outreach worker ridealongs

 1 triage counselor shadowing

 Ongoing design reviews and program check-ins

 See all research findings here: O&E Shadowing (Dispatch Team & Field Clinicians) 
 üßçPersonas
 Armin, O&E Administrator 
 Goals: He wants to be able to keep track of incoming referrals and see which outreach workers are dispatched onto what cases, and track cases and staff as they progress.

 Motivations: He wants to make sure that participants that need help are receiving timely care. He also wants to make sure that staff are safe and able to work with the participants.

 Frustrations: He's frustrated that he has no way to track staff's progress in the field and has limited information about the participant and the cases attached to them.

 Tammy, O&E Outreach Worker 
 Goals: She wants to be notified when a new case is assigned to her, no matter where she is in the county. She wants to be able to keep track of all the cases that are assigned to her and record outcomes in an app while out in the field.

 Motivations: She wants to be able to administer care to participants effectively and make sure no people in need are falling through the cracks because of disorganization.

 Frustrations: She is frustrated because she has to manage cases by taking notes on a piece of paper while she's out in the field. Sometimes she forgets to track something about a client because she has a lot going on at once.

 üîÄ Functional Workflow: Future State
 https://www.figma.com/file/ttLVUasjMzHujLXXAvPSf5/O%26E-Functional-Workflow?type=whiteboard&node-id=0%3A1&t=B6AVO9jcLUfbwpj8-1 
 Success Metrics 
 Goal 
 Metric 

 Ensure timely response to triage requests and services for clients
 Time from referral request to starting interaction with client (linkage)

 Rate of triage requests that result in linkage

 Rate of closed triage requests

 Reduce admin burden related to double data entry 
 Reduced number of paper-based referrals

 Decreased data entry required in HMIS

 Future Roadmap
 Integrate UAF experience into mobile referrals & dispatch workflow
 Sending referrals for clients encountered via UAF

 Dropping pins in dispatches

 Update client profile experience
 Comprehensive history of dispatches & UAF encounters

 Add Geotab support for county vehicles

 Requirements 
 See epics and related stories for most up-to-date details.
 Epics 

 CP-3307 a9d3eb4c-c63a-3c77-864c-b5dd8664a020 System Jira 

 CP-3309 a9d3eb4c-c63a-3c77-864c-b5dd8664a020 System Jira 

 CP-4404 a9d3eb4c-c63a-3c77-864c-b5dd8664a020 System Jira 

 CP-3315 a9d3eb4c-c63a-3c77-864c-b5dd8664a020 System Jira 

 CP-3320 a9d3eb4c-c63a-3c77-864c-b5dd8664a020 System Jira 

 CP-4535 a9d3eb4c-c63a-3c77-864c-b5dd8664a020 System Jira 

 Program Specific Questions 
 See the Referral Information Form confluence page for all program specific questions.
 Incoming Referral Dashboard 

 User Story : As an O&E Admin, I want the ability to manage incoming referrals so that I can make sure cases are being accepted and assigned appropriately.
 Requirements :
 View all incoming referrals and filter by:
 Participant, SPA, City, Referral Date, Status, Worker , Supervisor
 When users filter by "worker," it should display them regardless of which role they're assigned on the case (primary field worker, field worker #2, field worker #3, etc.) 

 The referrals should default sort from newest to oldest referrals
 However, Admins want the ability to sort by oldest to newest as well

 Manage Referral Page 
 User Story : As an O&E Admin, I want the ability to view the details of the referral so that I can gain information about the participant, their location, and their needs before dispatching a worker.

 Requirements : 
 Page will include:
 Referral information and client information 
 There should be two edit buttons - one to edit the referral info and one to edit client info
 Note that multiple referrals might apply to one client, so if client info is edited, it will be reflected in all cases/referrals attached to that client. If referral info is edited, it will remain with that specific case.

 There should also be the ability to change the client and create a new client as needed

 Assignment details and send dispatch button
 Assignee, Assignment Date, Supervisor

 Case Status
 Requested

 In Review

 Triage Requested

 Assigned

 Dispatch Accepted (Dispatch Not Accepted)

 Start Interaction

 End Interaction

 Cleared

 Referral Not Accepted

 Not Linked

 Case Outcomes
 Engaged in O&E services

 Provided resources only

 Unable to locate

 Declined

 Duplicate triage request

 O&E Criteria not met

 O&E Referrals 
 Ability to send a referral to another provider
 Provide list of commonly referred to providers (List TBD!)
 This list must be flexible as providers come in and out of the system of care

 Provide access to the full set of providers for users to search for the appropriate provider

 May need to support filters for searching this list of providers - this should ideally be the same list and filters as the OC Navigator

 Dispatch Dashboard 
 User Story : As an O&E Administrator, I want to be able to track cases from the time we've received them to the time they're closed so that no cases fall through the cracks.

 Requirements : 
 Need to include the following data fields on the cards:
 Client

 City & SPA

 O&E Field workers assigned

 RP: Reporting Party

 When the status was last updated

 When the referral was received

 Number of attempts someone has made to start the assessment

 This dispatch dashboard needs to be filterable by SPA (e.g., as a Regional Supervisor, I only want to see cases in the North SPA)

 Needs to have an Activity Log (similar to CAT Dispatch dashboard)

 Column headers should be (subject to change based on client feedback):
 Triage Requested

 Assigned

 Dispatch Accepted

 Start Interaction

 End Interaction

 Cleared

 Mobile SMS/Email Notifications 
 User Story : As an O&E outreach worker, I want to receive an SMS and email notification so that I know when a new case has been assigned to me.

 Requirements :
 The worker receives a text/email when an administrator has assigned them to a case

 They click a link in the text/email which takes them to their case dashboard in the O&E mobile app

 Mobile Cases Dashboard 
 User Story : As an O&E Outreach Worker, I want to view new and existing cases that are assigned to me so that I can manage my workload.

 Requirements : 
 Outreach worker views their assigned cases on a dashboard
 New cases that they have not accepted are at the top of the screen

 They have the ability to call dispatch if they are not able to accept a new case

 Cases they have already accepted and are working on are below new cases

 Mobile Details Tab 
 User Story : As an O&E Outreach Worker, I can view and edit participant details & case details so that I can manage a case I am working on.

 Requirements : 
 Outreach workers can view the details of a case and edit participant information or edit case details
 There should be a warning after a worker attempts to edit a participant and save the changes: "Are you sure you want to make this change?"
 This is because editing the participant's details will update their information on ALL cases associated with them

 Mobile My Progress Tab 
 User Story : As an O&E Outreach Worker, I want to update the status of a case as I work on it so that my administrator can be aware of my progress and safety.

 Requirements :
 Field workers can update the status of the case
 Geolocation is needed to get the current location
 Address is preferred over LAT/LONG since it is more easily editable

 Statuses available to the outreach worker include:
 Accepted

 Start Interaction

 End Interaction

 Cleared

 Not Linked

 Statuses may be attempted multiple times
 Each time a status is attempted, the time and location must be documented

 The number of times a status is attempted needs to be documented

 Mobile Activity Log 
 User Story : As an O&E Outreach Worker, I can view a log of all activity on the case I am working on so I can check on any details I need.

 Requirements :
 Displays all activity on the case (activity log)

 Mobile Outcomes Tab 
 Outcomes should be documented at the end of the case with the ability to send referrals
 List of outcomes:
 Engaged in O&E services

 Provided resources only

 Unable to locate

 Declined

 Duplicate triage request

 O&E Criteria not met

 Provide list of commonly referred to providers (TBD)
 This list must be flexible as providers come in and out of the system of care

 Provide access to the full set of providers for users to search for the appropriate provider

 May need to support filters for searching this list of providers - this should ideally be the same list and filters as the OC Navigator

 Users also want the ability to print resources on mobile printers in the field

 Referrals & Linkages Module: Desktop & Mobile 
 Outreach workers can access OC Navigator resource list

 Document referrals and linkages to other programs & providers.
 O&E's top client referrals:
 Mental Health Provider (appointment) 

 Physical Health
 (linking to Primary Care Provider, or appointment (They call CalOptima to schedule) 

 DMV ID (required for O&E reporting needs) 
 Client has an ID application that is filled out, and if there is need they will be given a bus pass or drive to DMV 

 Basic Needs
 Food, clothing, social services, CalFresh, hygiene kits, Bus Pass (popular resource referral for O&E)

 Shelter 

 Housing 

 Legal Services

 CalAim

 üö¶Statuses
 https://www.figma.com/file/EprYbsNopmnathUoGWew7g/Statuses?type=whiteboard&node-id=0%3A1&t=4EBaa523sGBDL2BV-1

 What is the proper way to refer to a field worker?
 Outreach worker

 What (if any) fields are required for incoming referrals? From OC Links? From O&E?

 Up to 100
