title: Geotab Client & Vendor Meeting Series
ancestors: OC Improve Dispatch Response & Safety (Geotab) PRD
content:
https://geotab.github.io/sdk/ : SDK Resource 
 Follow Up: Geotab & Chorus (Associating Individuals with Vehicles) 

 11:00am
 Attendees : 
 Chorus: Carter, Katy Jeter, Shane, Sarah
 Geotab: Drake Zwahlen
 Options for Associating Individuals with Vehicles: 
 Geotab Drive: 
 Can a user sign into Geotab drive, while in their personal vehicle rather than a fleet vehicle? 
 Geotab drive can only be used to indicate the location and status of a single driver utilizing a vehicle installed with Geotab hardware , it can not account for personal vehicles or passengers riding in such vehicles. Geotab Drive is used for logging things like Pre/Post Trip outcomes, tracking when a driver has entered into the vehicle and when they exit, etc. There is no additional cost to use Geotab drive. 

 Is there a way to turn off the Geotab data that records the trip?
 Yes, but this would have to be done by department if they don't want GPS, activated 

 Can you have multiple people associated with a single vehicle?
 Only one person should be assigned to a vehicle based on "who's hand is on the steering wheel". The data that Geotab tab collects is in relation to the driver not the passenger 

 If needed Drake shared that he could further investigate the option for customizing Geotab drive to add an additional person as a new field 
 If we considered this option, Chorus would need to verify if our API can pull and read into our system 

 Limitation:
 Geotab drive doesn't require the user to engage with sign on, there is no enforcement. People may forget to sign into the app to indicate that they are driving a specified vehicle that day 

 Key Fob 
 Can you share more about how these work? Strengths/limitations? 
 They're call NFC Readers and they cost 65$ per reader plus installation. The reader is more expensive but the additional "card" is about 2$ per card if the program wanted to buy back ups. 

 If a user forgets to activate the NFC reader, an audible alert will go off until the driver signs in. It increases likelihood of driver engaging and logging the datapoint 

 The key fob can only indicate one driver at a time . If two individuals both had key fobs, and both scanned the NFC reader, the person who was last to scan, would be the person who Geotab will have indicated as the driver of the car. 

 General Questions: 
 How does Geotab account for low reception coverage data? What happens to the data stream while out of service? 
 If driver goes into low coverage area, Geotab stores data at the last registered location before coverage was lost and will keep that location as the vehicle location until service is found again. 

 Discovery: CAT & Chorus (Pain Points and Goals) 

 9:00am
 Attendees : 
 Chorus: 
 Sarah, Carter, Shane, JJ, Phoenix
 OC:
 Amy Couch 
 Erika Punchard
 Ryan Yowell
 Matthew Kee
 Vanessa Thomas
 Questions: 
 Do all CAT staff use the same vehicle each time or does this change? 
 If it changes, what is the frequency? 

 Is there a grouping of existing fleet vehicles associated with CAT? 

 Right now there are 5 CAT county fleet vehicles\

 If responding in pairs and there are 21 vehicles in the future, not everyone will be able to have a utilize a CAT vehicle

 Timeline for when all 21 vehicles will be up and running 
 May 2024

 The fleet vehicles will be retrofitted with a double cell in the back of the car similar to law enforcement barriers 

 Deliver date for vehicles could be spring 2024
 maybe later than May 

 Clinician teams will be going out in pairs
 This pilot has already started

 Full staffing of teams is not complete; program is currently hiring more staff

 Currently all staff are able to use all fleet vehicles one staff is not associated with each fleet vehicles 
 How are we going to match clinicians to the vehicles 

 Two vehicles are ADA vans, if need to assign one for the whole day, they can, but need it flexible 
 e.g. could select the vehicle they're assigned to in the moment when they accept a dispatch 

 CAT is still fleshing out how they will assign staff to each vehicle 

 Are there certain limitations of fleet vehicle information that can be captured and shared considering privacy and union regulations?
 Can track the car but not the staff 

 Could be voluntary that they sign on virutally for the day 

 For dispatching need to know where the cars are 

 For safety would be nice to know who was in which car 

 Nothing wrong knowing where the staff is, 

 Clinicians are already being track for which cars they're using
 they're already using this

 All clinicians are using county phones that could be tracked 

 How are we going to track car and how are going to associate the clinician with the car 
 CAT is tracking the cars, but if there's another section of the platfrom to see who is assigned to the vehicles then we can coordinate dispatch 

 Pairs 
 Will they be the same pair for the whole day?
 Still being decided, but ideally the pair will be for the whole day, but may need the ability to edit and change pairs 
 one may go home sick or have expertise that needs to be assigned 

 Do CAT vehicles already have Geotab installed? If not, is there an estimated timeline when the hardware will be installed? 
 The vehicles will have Geotab installed in May

 Police officers use their computers as GPS system, if teams are using their own cars, and computers use GPS locators, could we create a system where everyone is able to be track and integrate Geotab Drive with the app feature 
 would prefer for all staff to be able to transport 

 Notes : 
 Pain Point is CAT program's lack of expertise in the area and figuring out what is going to work best for program

 Toured Sherif dispatch center and learned how they track and monitor their units

 Hopes/dreams are to be able to see where staff are, have it integrate into chorus dispatch process that is currently being utilized 

 They want to know where vehicles are in real time

 How to ensure safety of staff
 e.g.they accept a call but the car hasn't moved they can follow up

 Know where everyone i so they have more realtime or mapping information 

 Must ensure response times are 60 minutes across the board from the time the need is identified to when they arrive on the seen
 60 min from when call comes in from the arrival of the staff
 the way it's currently being tracked is tricky

 making MHSA goals o 75% are 30 min or less 

 The data requirements 
 when the need is identified 
 is the start of the timer

 The moment a clinician leave the location they're at is the start of the clock 

 When the call comes in and the call determines that a CAT need is necessary then the clock starts for connection 
 Part missing:
 The initial time that the call comes in

 The new benefit: 
 still trying to determine when the clinician has accepted this 

 eg. Client calls OC Links, then OC Links connects to CAT, but how is that captured? 
 want to capture the moment that CAT dispatch leaves 

 Metrics should be with OC links send the dispatch to CAT 
 Has to be when the dispatch questions are asked 

 It depends on the type of call, some can be determined early on that it would be a CAT call vs others will take more time

 Needs to be individualized so it's not one size fits all

 Idea that theres a button pressed to generate the "clock" to start
 the button could be a priority call generated dispatch now 

 Won't dispatch until they have the information, but the state doesn't care they just care that once the call comes in and it's been determined that the crisis is needed then the clock starts regardless of coordinating details 

 MHSA reform dependent (going to ballet next year) 

 60 minute Dispatch planning
 The clock starts when need is identified

 Idea that a caller in could click a button that starts a timer AFTER the need is identified 

 Then dispatcher could continue their collection of additional information 
 for some calls an OC links operator might know earlier in the call rather than later 

 OC Links dispatcher dispatch staff to the field 

 Currently looking to build the scheduler into Chorus 
 for children's it goes to the officer of the day and then the OD dispatches 

 when they end up in the list then they dispatch to the location 

 Dispatch decision tree
 when they get to dispatch → Yes, then that could be when the caller clicks the button

 Discovery: Geotab & Chorus Technical Feasibility 

 3:00 pm
 Attendees: 
 Chorus : 
 Carter, Shane, JJ, Sarah
 Geotab: 
 Drake Zwahlen: BD with Geotab; runs the west region for public sector 
 Brianne Biczo: Public Sector Account advisor, handles west coast public sector accounts
 Agenda : 
 PDs ask their prepared questions to understand feasibility 
 Prepared Questions and Meeting Answers: 
 Can Geotab manage logic for closet clinician in the field to closest client referral 
 Geotab can work with Refuge for high density routing
 Geotab isn't does not offer routing because they don't know the driver destination just the driver's current location and history of location

 Chorus would have to account for destination if they wanted to offer the ability for a user to factor in arrival time
 Geotab tracks things such as 
 RPM of engine

 Vehicle speed

 If a driver is using their seat belt, etc.

 If it was a build requirement to provide arrival time within the chorus app, Chorus to calculate arrival time based speed limits in the area, Geotab data of vehicle location, and current speed 

 Can Geotab send Chorus data in real time? 
 Yes, it just depends on what Chorus & OC needs
 eg.g do the data pushes need to occur second by second vs instant call out 

 Fleet management is not getting real time data, just assess health (oil changes, etc.)

 how is that data sent
 Access via myGeotab , get a dashboard of all the data

 at what frequency
 Chorus & OC can determine the frequency as needed 

 Are there costs associated with access OC Fleet Geotab Data? If so, who pays this cost? 
 No extra cost to access the Geotab data and Geotab is already tracking all OC Fleet Vehicles with the hardware installed 

 Customer pays monthly to access their data 
 Chorus will NOT need an extra license and there's no extra fee to access the data

 Chorus will just need OC permission to access MyGeotab online portal & data repository 

 Can Geotab translate distance to time to arrival for dispatch 
 No but they have the data needed to calculate it based on determined destination

 Are there any costs associated with regular API calls for all fleet vehicle data in real time? 
 no extra cost for Chorus to collect that data because the county is already paying for this. 

 Does Geotab have the ability to overlay vehicles on a map? 
 Geotab pays a license for mapping so they can't sublet out to a developer

 Chorus would need to buy our own map and then use Geotab API to populate it, Chorus could use Geotab SDK and use the code on the script to plug into the map 

 Additional Notes: 
 Geotab can also track the location of a human outside the fleet vehicle if they have a key fob associated with them
 OC's not currently doing this
 if they want to track an individual, the clinician would need to swipe a key fob to track individual user to various car

 $65 per fob 

 OC is paying for access to their fleet data via Geotab
 They have the ability to use Geotab SDK to populate their data into Chorus apps

 OC Fleet department is currently collecting fleet engine health specifics
 They've recently partnered with other social service programs to identify other programatic needs that could be supported by leveraging existing Geotab technology 

 Geotab Questions to Chorus
 Need to know if the vehicle is always assigned to an individual, is it constant? 

 It would make it easier to associate individual A to vehicle A

 It wouldn't be an expensive need to be able to differentiate user
 Could assign a set of vehicles all grouped into a Crisis Group and could assign the keys. In this grouping, the program you wouldn't need a key fob to account for each field clinician 

 GeoFences 
 Geotab has the ability to plot a field for areas that may be hazard zones or have a history of being unsafe 
 supervisor can be alerted if a stop is taking too long for safety reasons or in an unsafe area

 Fleet 
 OC is on the highest level plan and can use up as much data as they want

 They currently have access to more data than they need 

 Right now the vehicles have second by second data being captured in real time for every asset 
 Chorus would need access to the parent account for Human services, chorus could have real time data for every vehicle IF it's moving 
 If it's not moving, the data available with be the most up to date data of when the vehicle was last used

 Associating Vehicles with users 
 Could install Geotab drive on field clinician's work phones 
 no additional cost for that 

 Could also manually put in license plate number in Geotab drive

 Fail point is that it's devise dependent
 Easy for users to forget to check in 

 CAT staff have work issued phone that they require to access CAT so they could use the Geotab drive option there too

 Integrations
 Geotab doesn't integrate, their partners integrate

 Geotab provides constant information that can be pulled from from partners 

 Go to Geotab market place to see resources available

 Chorus could be in the Geotab market place if we were interested 
 It's not vetted out 100%

 Chorus could be added to the market easily 
 very channel friendly market 

 Chorus advertise that we can partner with Geotab
 We can give Geotab a list of our clients and let them know that the integration is available 

 Important to client
 Staff want to get credit for the work they do so need name associated with their case 

 Implementation Timeline 
 OC received the hardware last week to integrate (June 19th 2023) 

 Implementation is for when the vehicles are scheduled to come to the shop for their scheduled maintenance
 that is when they will update vehicles as they roll out

 Fleet is willing to adjust timeline as needed based on program needs 

 OC is monitoring 1400 of their fleet vehicles 

 Meeting 
 Attendees 
 Notes 

 Geotab & CAT Program Initial Meeting 

 * This was an initial meeting with Geotab Reps, County Program Staff, County Fleet Staff and Chorus 

 Chorus :
 Sarah Burdette

 Austin Heap

 Carter Moar

 Julie Jessup

 OC : 
 Matthew Kee

 Linda Molina

 Erika Punchard

 Amy Couch 

 Omar Leyva

 Geotab :
 Drake Z
 Brianne Biczo
 Geotab collects data on the asset targeted
 Vehicle health and utilization

 Helps agencies service their vehicles
 if something enters the area or a fueling event is needed

 If a driver is not wearing a seatbelt

 Backing into a parking spot vs driving directly in

 Largest service provider for tracking

 Contract with state and federal agencies

 Data
 meats all IT security requirements in CA

 OC data is owned by county 

 Has a SDK (software development kit)
 can pull data into any system you want

 dependent on how it's hosted
 can use a script, make an API call, and then pull that data into chorus 

 e.g. location data, mileage, etc. 

 data is by vehicle
 not tracked by person, unless you assign a vehicle to a person

 OC Requests & Requirements 
 OC wanted to set the meeting up to understand if Geotab would communicate with Chorus in terms with Geomapping for Crisis Assessment teams 

 Want to improve dispatching efficiency because don't know where staff are
 they call in every two hours 

 under fed requirement to improve response times 

 Want to explore ways to better track vehicles to be able to dispatch vehicles and staff in a timely manner 

 SDK database is flexible and can be created as needed

 Chorus could get APIs SDK, we can review the SDKs, and depending on log in needs, we can create rules on that
 You can coordinate skillset of staff needed and dispatch the grouping based on the fleet team
 the administrator would pull all the administrators, location data, and then be able to quickly asses and classify as needed

 Need to determine IF we can put location data into Chorus
 depending on the rulesets within Chorus, Chorus will review the SDK, see the API calls that we can pull from Geotab and align requirements with Geotab functionality 

 E.g. Can go into Geotab and see where staff are on a map, collect data with rules behind it in chorus, can improve dispatch based on skillset and locatoin

 Goal: replace the need for staff to drop pins & have a map of where things are in real time 
 can get access into myGeotab with real time tracking and it shows it on a map 

 The frequency of Chorus visibility is dependent on the API call that is coordinated within Chorus 

 Chorus Question to Geotab
 Does Geotab do imbedded Viz or imbedded maps?
 They may have imbedded maps, but Drake will have to follow up on this

 Carter will email Drake to clarify with imbedded tabs 

 Geotab https://geotab.github.io/sdk/ 

 Vehicles that are using it currently
 if vehicles have a unit number, they will have Geotab

 Law enforcement may have exemptions on the GPS program

 ANY county vehicle with a unit number & fleet services is maintaining them, then they will have GPS services installed (Geotab)
 Its coming pre-installed 

 Need to know who will be the administrator for this work for HCA as a whole and then they can start breaking it down by department
 HCA wants to set up training for the agency department on how to utilize the Geotab service and resource

 Each HCA department may have their own use case and workflows 

 Can HCA designate individuals as administrators to oversee programs under the agencies
 Covered by 1 agency admin
 set ups

 rights

 questions/admin support 

 Next Steps
 What departments will Chorus be working with (O&E, CAT?)
 What are their requirements 

 What problems are they trying to solve 

 Chorus will review SDK and follow up with Drake for questions

title: CRP Shadowing
content:
Objectives
 Shadow administrators and clinicians while they intake referrals and clients and track progress through discharge

 Better understand how users are interacting with other systems to find areas of opportunity

 Learn how CRP employees receive and send referrals as we look to develop this capability in Chorus

 Important note: this research will only ever be used internally to guide product design only with this product team, we will never share data and will always keep data private

 Helpful Tips While Shadowing
 Meet with a supervisor or manager, etc as a team first when you arrive
 Introduce yourselves

 Reiterate expectations (how long you'll be there, what you're looking for, etc)

 Get tips on how to participate w/o getting in the way

 Divide and conquer so we can get more data back. I'd have each of you shadow individually, and try to shadow as many as you can. An ideal data set would be 5+ people. If we can shadow 5+ people and observe 10-20 use cases, that would be amazing (not sure how long a 'case' will last, but you get the idea: more is better).

 Ask the person you're shadowing to think out loud (when appropriate) to talk through what they're feeling, what they need, what they dislike, what they like. (as long as it doesn't interfere or diminish the experience/task they're working on). If it's not appropriate to verbalize thinking while with a client, quickly chat for a few mins between client interactions to capture what they were thinking

 Before shadowing occurs ‚Äì participants are interviewed or involved in group discussions to learn more about their needs.

 During shadowing ‚Äì the shadow works with a commentator who explains what is being observed throughout the study. This is most often used when the shadow is facing a complex situation where a full explanation (or training) has not been available before shadowing commences.

 üìù Treehouse North CRP
 Staff members 
 Amy Couch - Contact Monitor (Licensed social worker)

 Tony - Clinical Director

 Edward - Residential Counselor

 Jaqueline - Program Administrator (licensed MFT)

 Bed Status 
 Open

 Taken

 Review

 On Hold
 If a client is offsite at an appointment, temporary 51/50. 24 Hour and voluntary it is shorter.

 At any point the client can decide they don't want to go to the CRP or they want to leave

 Beds by gender to consider showing as a part of availability. Since the rooms are occupied by same gender it would be good to see if they could see 1 male open so that if they received a inquiry about a male needing a room the open status would be more helpful if it included gender. If the room is empty it could be for either gender. (Q: Policy on gender identification)

 Referral Statuses 
 Accepted - Can be in accepted status but during the drive there, phone call, intake decides not to do the program. Would change to Not Accepted but a specific reason other than better served might be needed for this specific reason.

 Intake process very insightful how the client and counselor interact. There are 3 parts to the intake process:

 Facility (House rules…). This is the portion we saw. Lots of paperwork including (takes 30-45 minutes): 
 Signing for services provideed and following program rules

 Consent form for telehealth with psychiatrist

 General information (closest relative, financial responsibility, address, emergency contact, hospital preference)

 Anti-hate/anti-violence signature

 House rules

 Visitation hours

 Acknowledgement that this is a voluntary program

 Disclosure of PHI to emergency contacts

 Authorization to take picture for identification purposes

 Consent for emergency treatment

 Allergies

 Acknowledgement that they will try to find them if they go missing

 Personal information

 Acknowledgement that if they leave for more than 24 hours they can't come back

 Also provide personal hygiene items and clothes

 Then they need to shower

 Clinical

 Medical

 Transferring between the same CRP. Example: Treehouse South to Treehouse North. The process happens behind the scenes and is not common. 
 Treehouse South sets status to DISCHARGE. (Reason?) Opens bed availability in South.

 Treehouse North sees the request on their dashboard. (Treehouse South would see bed availability with gender and know that they could be open and good fit for client so they do an OUTGOING Referral to Treehouse South.)

 Treehouse South sees the request and follows the transfer process and their bed status updates.

 Typical Stay / Background on CRP 
 Typically stay 21 days, older adults have more needs: medical, transient, sometimes don't have IDs which are needed for some outgoing referrals
 It was bumped up from 14 days to 21 days because 14 days was too short to be successful

 They are mandated by the state to allow for extensions 
 Able to extend stay for the week, every week

 Up to 3 months per CCL

 Completely voluntary - can walk out at any time but if they leave they're not guaranteed a space if they want to come back

 There are six beds, today there were 4 people there when we got there, one person was admitted
 Usually at full capacity

 Two to a room, same sex rooms

 Not all CRPs are in a home setting, but TREEhouse North is
 Coastal Star is a bigger CRP in an industrial setting and has 15 beds

 In 2018 they were contracted with HCA, but TREEhouse North is operated by Telecare

 They can see a doctor, nurse, or psychiatrist through telehealth and do medication adjustments

 TREEhouse North has an ADU room 

 Treehouse north has to adhere to DHCS, CCL (Community Care Licensing), and County rules - have to make all three happy

 CRPs are 24/7 with staff available at all times

 Intake (similar to all other CRPs):
 They have an intake office right next to the garage

 All personal items are put in a bug zapper for a couple hours

 Any sharps or dangerous objects are put in a locker

 Outgoing Referrals 
 The outgoing referral process is a very important and mandatory item to complete and part of the program. It is something that is setup early in the accepted or intake process.
 "Start talking discharge at the time of admission"

 There are sometimes not a lot of places to refer individuals to, so they extend their stay at the CRP

 Destinations: older adult services, OASIS (provide more intensive care and help for unhoused - place client same day), outpatient programs, year round emergency shelter beds (majority of the time they're at full capacity
 Will sometimes send them to a supportive environment (family, friends, etc.)

 Method: Phone call and fax information (medication, treatment plan, etc.)
 Blank copies linked here 

 They prefer for the client to lead the referral process and empower the client to make those calls
 However, they will step in if needed

 System Usage 
 About to switch over to a new EHR through Telecare (Avatar)

 CRP staff do have access to IRIS, but it's limited
 They can look up a client and do a client search

 Concerns over a new system 
 They're not always at their desk, they were worried that an email or text would be missed. Currently when they get a referral they receive a call at the office
 They have 15 minutes to get in touch with the referring party

 Since they're not always on their computer they'd like a mobile version

 Amy wants a referral to go to all CRPs
 Her goal is that it is easier for CRPs to coordinate care and communicate with each other

 Want less admission denials

 TAY CRP doesn't see anyone older than 25, but it doesn't harm them to see referrals (especially because there can be missing information in referrals including DOB)

 Excited about
 Seeing referral history for their frequent fliers

 Info Received on Tustin Children and Tustin TAY Before Visiting
 All Children and TAY CRPs are operated by Waymakers who is contracted by OC (They've been the only provider for forever)
 Children CRPs
 Age range: 12-18

 Locations
 Tustin - hub of the referral process

 Laguna Beach

 Huntington Beach

 Average length of stay: 7-10 days

 TAY (1 location = Tustin)
 Age range: 18-26

 TAY population is unique, so Matthew Kee (Manager for Child and Youth Services) and Seneca (Contract Monitor) said it would be really beneficial to see this

 Average length of stay: 10-14 days

 Context and change in the county
 Historically, the children and adult programs have been kept very separate, but the county is hoping to bring them together and have the same type of model for similar programs across children and adult (e.g., all CRPs are organized together)

 There has been some worry that children and TAY specific needs will get lost in the shuffle

 Differences seen in children CRPs (in comparison to adult CRPs)
 Lots of family involvement

 Don't have nursing on site (Adult has nursing)

 Some psychiatrist hours but limited

 Different referral sources, for example hospitals are a larger referral source for children
 Seneca and Matthew expressed that they don't want of all of these people to add their referrals directly to the bed board 
 Would be interesting to know why 

 TAY CRP does not take from hospitals, except for a few specific contracts

 Anticipated challenges for the CRP Bed Board
 Waymakers is a very paper bound program. They don't have an EHR and don't have any plans to have an EHR

 Providers are meticulous about the details coming and don't accept a referral without full information

 OC will have to make it a stipulation of their contract to fill out the Bed Board

 Currently Waymakers only does phone calls to provide availability

 Anticipated successes for the CRP Bed Board
 Reduce the back and forth and create a level of transparency that children CRPs do not have

 Believe staff would like this and would help broaden the number of people who can review referrals (which they've been in the process of trying to do) rather than only 1-2 people doing admissions

 Requests from Seneca and Matt
 Ability to print a referral and add it to a client's paper chart at Waymakers

 Would like CRPs to be able to see CAT and CSU history - would find this helpful

 CRPs have access to IRIS (OC EHR) and can search for a client 
 Inpatient contracts do not have access to IRIS, different type of contract

 When Shadowing: 
 Show them CSU Bed Board Screenshots 

 Lot of change in the systems and CalAIM documentation, MHSA changes pending, so CRPs may be a bit more anxious about change 

 Children's CRPs
 Staff Members 
 Seneca is the Contract Monitor for CRP Youth programs

 Carol Carlson - Director at Waymakers

 Chantay - Manager for Tustin?

 Childrens CRPs have someone on call at all times (rotates)

 General info about the CRPs 
 100% voluntary

 Staff at CRPs are LPS designated and can right an involuntary hold

 Two clinicians at each house

 Summer and fall are slower. October gets busy into spring
 Used to carry a waitlist, but now don't

 Crisis needs to occur in OC to qualify for a CRP

 Client name and DOB are the most reliable identifiers, phone number is less reliable

 Concurrent review is not in play for Childrens yet but it is in place for TAY
 We may want to build in concurrent review just in case since the state requirements for adults typically roll down to childrens

 We can focus on building CRPs first and then add later

 Bed Assignments 
 16 beds for Children CRPs

 Each bedroom is dual occupancy

 Bed allocation is very strategic. Examples:
 Gender - There are 2 beds per room, and they keep these rooms same gender
 For childrens, it's organized by sex assigned at birth

 For TAY, it depends (need to follow up with Sarah on this one)

 Bedrooms are assigned to gender based on need. For example, bedrooms could be have male occupants one day and female occupants the next depending on need

 Sometimes there are two bedrooms that share a bathroom (e.g., TAY), in which case they will keep everyone on that floor the same gender

 Location - they try to send the client to the CRP closest to them, but this doesn't always work based on availability and other factors

 If a hospital releases many clients on the same day to a CRP, then Waymakers tries to split clients up

 If a client could potentially to be violent to their roommate, then they will likely have them stay by themselves - this is uncommon but happens

 If a client is known for trying to form a romantic relationship with their roommate, then they will likely have them stay by themselves

 For these reasons, they would rather not show the beds open at each Waymakers location, rather they would like to share the beds open at Waymakers in total
 There are factors which could change where they're going

 They have also experienced pain points where a hospital tells a client "You should go to Waymakers Laguna Beach because it's close to your home or close to the beach" and then the client can't actually go there because of bed availability or competing factors

 Process 
 ALL incoming referrals are made by phone calls 
 Typically they receive a first call to simply ask if a bed is available so that they can offer it to a client
 All calls come into the Tustin location for approval

 Then an additional phone call is received when the client is ready for the CRP. These calls are helpful for follow up questions (e.g., violent to friends in the past? violent to family? if only violent to family then they may be able to come to the CRP - nuance may not be able to be captured in a form without some sort of interview screening)
 Help better understand if the client is okay with the program and the rules of the program

 Interview the Reporting Party (RP), Client, and Parent - sometimes at different times
 Could be three separate calls or one call

 They will accept clients even if their parent is not there (since CAT can see child without parent)
 Serve foster youth and will not speak with parent, will need social workers contact

 Generally trying to understand:
 History

 Willingness to come

 Risk to current clients

 Whether client will benefit from the program

 Fill out TC form 
 Verbally go through the entire page with the client

 The second that they start the referral, the bed is on hold for that person, even before it's officially accepted 
 24 hour hold

 Have told hospitals to not call unless they're close to discharge

 Receive additional information through fax. This information isn't required to accept a referral, but it's helpful to validate info

 Staff calls one of the three staff members to get approval for assigning a client to a bed

 Client comes in and receives care. They are provided with outgoing referrals. Therapist will follow up with the provider for outgoing referrals maybe but not a typical path. Only stabilizing and linking with ongoing care

 Referral sources 
 80% are hospital step downs or CAT

 Inpatient 

 Rarely IHCS or psychiatrist at county clinic

 Tools 
 No EHR - all paper charts

 Every location has a shelter roster of every client in paper forms

 They do use IRIS for every client
 Progress notes are in IRIS for billing

 They also use the continuum of care report in IRIS and a census report that shows past history with the CRP 
 They can look up by client name and birthday

 Feature requests
 Want the ability to print out referral so that it can be incorporated into their paper chart

 Access offsite while they're at home

 Mobile optimized (get calls in the grocery store, so it would be more private if they could just pull it up on their phone)
 Not typically working at a desk

 Since there are three staff members that approve all referrals, they would like to receive a notification for this 
 Could all receive a notification

 Waymakers TAY CRP
 Staff 
 Jordan

 Marissa - clinician

 Lisa - Program Director (on leave)

 General info about the Waymakers TAY CRP 
 6 beds
 2 pods
 2 dual occupancy bedrooms upstairs (single gender) - unlike children's they will have rooms based on gender not sex assigned at birth

 1 dual occupancy bedroom downstairs

 Ages: 18-25

 Waymakers TAY opened in March 2022

 Do not want to indicate that it is a 21 day program because they do not guarantee stay for that long. It is a crisis stabilization program

 Non ambulatory and self administer 

 If they fall between between 18-25 call here first. If a referral sources gets denied then they can send referral elsewhere

 More calls later in the evening or middle of the night

 Differences between TAY and Childrens 
 Referral questions
 All adults use the same referring forms, however TAY is not on the adult form, it's a Tay specific form because licensing is different 

 Currently ask about employment or school and how they are going to be able to dedicate time to a program if they have a job or are in school. Typically people who have a 40 hour job are not in crisis

 CRP does not talk to the parent

 Smoke / drug dependency
 Many residents are nicotine dependent but Tustin TAY is smoke free

 Population comorbidity with drug use and may require medical clearance

 Need to specify with clients that this is a mental health crisis facility, not a housing resource
 Need to review what actually means crisis: dts, dto, gd

 Need to understand the crisis because the CRP does not technically help people that are still in crisis. There needs to be space to document referral reason with a narrative (that goes beyond checkboxes)

 TAY can take pregnant adults

 Identifiers are primarily name and DOB. Do not always get an address provided

 Providing updates on bed capacity 
 At the beginning of each day, TAY CRP emails a census to CSU Program Directors providing bed availability
 Then at each shift change (three times a day) the TAY CRP will call each CSU with bed availability

 Referral Sources 
 Most common: HCA CSU and College Hospital CSU

 Do NOT take from hospitals

 Outgoing Referrals 
 FSP (STAY) a place for clients to live, long term outpatient
 STAY is under pathways project 

 50% go to STAY. STAY only works with Tay (16-25)

 Make referral to STAY through fax or email. Karen at STAY receives referrals and let them know if they're admitted
 Karen emails or calls to let them know they were admitted and will go to Waymakers TAY to meet with the client

 Clients that come here and have oftentimes been linked with STAY before 

 A script describing the program is read after referral documentation is completed 
 CRP provides client with information and ask if they have understood
 Could be part of the initial referral form

 They would also like to document whether the physicians report has been completed as it is required within 72 hours of a client physically being there
 Checkbox to say whether it's been completed

 CSU could also add it as an attachment

 Medical questions (likely will not be included in the bed board) 
 Prescriptions are a part of the intake (e.g., current meds, whether a script needs to be sent to the pharmacy, etc.). Won't deny referral but they may put a hold on a bed while they're working on medications

 Meds are not entered into iris

 More of a checklist for do they have meds needed, are they nicotine dependent

title: Internal Geotab Planning Notes
ancestors: OC Improve Dispatch Response & Safety (Geotab) PRD
content:
Running list of meeting notes for Internal Geotab planning
 Geotab SDK for reference 

 Attendees: 
 Carter

 Sarah 

 Shane

 Mike

 JJ

 Agenda 
 Review 2 known client Pain Points

 Based on pain points, identify theoretical approach to solutions

 Identify questions to bring to Geotab rep at the meeting 

 Known Pain Points 
 Program needs to improve efficiency of dispatch 
 They want to know where dispatch staff are located in the field in real time so that they can assign field workers who are located closest to the client requiring services 

 CCMU funding requires that dispatch time from when a client referral comes in to when a staff is dispatched to the client 

 Program needs to understand and manage workforce capacity 
 They want to know how long dispatched field workers are spending with with each client so that they can understand how long client service sessions are taking, and use this information to support staff training and use as data to support additional hiring requests as needed 

 Concern from clinician that their location is being tracked by their supervisor 

 Internal Discussion 
 How does the county plan to access Geotab data 

 Can County go straight to Geotab for the data they need or an we create some UI to interface with Geotab 

 Idea:
 Chorus has access to real time data and then can populate CAT & OC Links apps as needed 

 What are the features of dispatch tracking
 When does it start and when does is stop

 What are the API calls and what does the cost look like?

 Use Case eg
 Dispatcher gets a case and gets button for all available staff

 Field worker needs to be continuously tracked during transit 
 need to be able to translate distance to time to arrival 

 How can we know which vehicle is assigned to each field worker 

 Anticipated general user journeys would be helpful for inform internal planning and brain storming meetings 

 Questions Identified to Bring to Geotab Rep Meeting on the 28th 
 Can Geotab manage logic for closed dispatch person to closest client referral

 Can Geotab send Chorus data in real time and if so
 how is that data sent 

 in what format and 

 at what frequency 

 If tracking all fleet vehicles how would Geotab do this?
 Are there costs associated with this? If so, who pays this cost?

 Can Geotab translate distance to time to arrival for dispatch

title: R&L Data Architecture Meeting Series
content:
The intention of this meeting series is to determine a strategic approach and method for capturing and sharing R&L data among Chorus apps. The first meeting is to collectively determine what we need the data architecture to accomplish , then following meetings are to plan how we want to accomplish that. 
 Reference Documents 
 Please Review These Before First Meeting
 OC Program R&L Status Fields 

 Current Referral Data Tables (CAT & OC Links) 

 Optional Review
 CRP Bed Board + Referrals & Linkages (R&L) PRD 

 CCMU Project Plan (includes current Chorus app that will utilize the determine data structure) 

 Meeting 
 Meeting Outcome Goal 
 Suggested Discussion Questions 
 Notes 

 Data Sharing BrainStorm 

 Attendees 
 Addie Nakatani

 Christy Forte

 Patrick Jeter

 Shane Bai

 Austin Heap

 Julie Jessup

 Mayra Solano

 Define what the data architecture and data sharing among apps needs to accomplish to align with: 
 client requirements

 chorus requirements

 platform capacity (current & future)

 future expansion to additional R&L programs

 consent management 

 *Addie will bring spreadsheet for client requirements
 What are the client's reporting requirements 
 CP-3234 a9d3eb4c-c63a-3c77-864c-b5dd8664a020 System JIRA 

 What kind of meta-data needs to be captured?
 Time stamp? Yes

 Who? Yes

 Haven't heard of anything specific to analytics yet. However this could inform metadata structure:
 Does the county want to know what the conversion rate is for county operated vs county contracted?

 What are the actual fields that should be shared among those who have access to R&L data 
 Client profiles across Crisis (OC Links, CAT, CRP, CSU, O&E)

 Referral/Case history - Among the crisis care system (OC Links, CAT, CRP, CSU), we will likely share all past history
 O&E - TBD

 Once we cross over into SUD programs, sharing SUD history will require an Authorization to Disclose (ATD) which identifies programs that the client has allowed the county to send data to
 Can we tie the ATD to the client's profile and add fields to specify which programs can see certain data?

 R&L Statuses 
 OC Program R&L Status Fields 

 "Requested" status 
 What logic would help user navigate client cases for those who were not accepted but still require services?

 Which programs if any, may require separate data tables? 

 Action items: 
 Addie to reach out to Sharon, CRPs, CSUs, O&E to see if they need any data or analytics coming out of Referrals & Linkages

 Addie to add PT example to ticket describing how there could be a first outgoing referral CP-3234 a9d3eb4c-c63a-3c77-864c-b5dd8664a020 System JIRA 

 Addie to email ask for signature sheet to Bill and Mike. Provide pre-read so that they have context. Need signatures on what data is accessible for all county contracted CRPs
 Identify what fields will be viewable, including:
 Link out to Patrick's Data Dictionary

 Pros
 Could help provide care and provide clinical context

 Cons
 Could ignore referrals

 Addie put documentation on Statuses in the PRD instead of the ticket since it's more ongoing

 Notes 
 OC Warmline - should this be included in this initial pilot? Maybe not too big
 NAMI will be separate client list

 Christy, Patrick and Austin are thinking about having separate apps, with one master app
 Will definitely need one client list (except for NAMI)

 Implied that data duplication is much higher than 20%

 They also implied that it is challenging to get reliable info for client profiles

 Data Architecture: Strategic Planning 

 Attendees 
 Addie Nakatani

 Armen Arevian

 Christy Forte

 Patrick Jeter

 Austin Heap

 Sarah Burdette

 Phoenix

 Based on what data sharing among apps needs to accomplish, determine HOW we want to plan the data architecture to align with the need. 
 If there are outstanding questions: 
 Identify questions and assign point person responsible for follow up at next meeting
 Should Chorus depreciate the repetitive tables or use data replication based on existing tables?

 Should Chorus refactoring existing apps or borrow from what's already been created among apps for R&L data sharing? 

 (focused on R&L and informed by: implications, risks, benefits, etc.) 
 Post Meeting Action Items: 

 1 
 complete 
 Sarah schedule and Audit Log Technical Review meeting with Austin, Armen, Christy F, Patrick, and others 

 2 
 complete

title: R&L Data Architecture
content:
Before we begin: a note on terminology
 Term 
 Definition 

 Client data 
 An individual's details and preferences. Examples: name, demographics, contact info, insurance, safety info (e.g., weapons history)

 Chorus Master Client Index (MCI) 
 The current client data table stored in the OC Links Application which is used for OC Links, CAT, O&E and will be used for CRPs and CSUs in the near future. This will ultimately be moved into a separate data layer and send/receive data from the program level apps. 
 It is being called the Chorus MCI to distinguish it from the IRIS MPI.

 Referral data 
 Information specific to a single referral. Examples:
 Source program - which individual program is the referral coming from? (e.g., Waymakers CRP in Laguna Beach)

 Destination program - which individual program is the referral going to?

 Status & reason

 Historical data 
 Past referral and case history across 1+ programs . Examples: 
 CAT case history

 OC Links case history

 CAT → CSU referral

 Authorization to Disclose (ATD) 
 Signed consent by the client to authorize their medical record PHI be shared with other named and listed programs. This is critical for SUD programs due to 42cfr legislation . OC ATD here 

 Client and Referral Data 
 Access to client information
 Assumption: If programs have access to look up a client in IRIS, then they should have access to look up a client in Chorus (confirmed by Sharon on 7/19/23)
 Program 
 Access to search mh client list (Crisis Designated Program) 
 Access to search sud client list (42 CFR Permissions) 
 Access to Crisis Program data: OC Links, CAT, O&E, CRPs, CSUs 

 OC Links
 yes 
 yes (confirmed by Tim. S)
 yes

 CAT
 yes 

 Update 08/03: Vanessa T confirmed that CAT will not have CFR 42 Designation in the future so they should not have SUD access 
 yes

 O&E 
 yes 
 Yes (Confirmed by Jennifer Dinicola) 
 yes

 CRPs
 yes 
 (Confirmed by Vanessa T)
 yes

 CSUs
 yes 
 (Confirmed by Vanessa T)
 yes

 OC Warmline

 Data fields
 Client Information 
 See tickets: 
 Resource Data
 See OC Categories and Initial Unified Database Planning doc for further detail.
 Outgoing referrals 
 We will be using the OC Navigator dataset as our resource database for CRP
 This was discussed with and approved by Sharon

 This is dependent on Data Sharing Between Apps . Release date: August 30, 2023

 We will be using the filters that currently exist in the OC Navigator for a consistent experience:
 Keyword

 Category

 City

 Language

 Actions (also listed above): 
 Addie to ask each CRP to:
 Identify in the OC Navigator the top ten resources that they refer out to, so that we can try to pin them to the top of their search list (like we do for OC Links)

 If they refer out to a program that is not in the OC Navigator, to let us know and we can look into adding it

 For outgoing referrals, we will want programs to be able to send referrals to a referral group or an individual program within a referral group 
 Individual program: refer to an individual CRP (e.g., previously worked with a CRP, hospital reached out to a CRP directly, etc.)

 Referral group: refer to the Youth CRP Group and the Adult CRP Group, so that multiple programs have the chance to claim a referral

 Action: Therefore, there needs to be two resources added to outgoing referrals:
 Youth CRP Referral Group

 Adult CRP Referral Group

 Incoming referrals 
 Proposal: We will be using the OC Navigator dataset as our resource database for incoming referrals

 Actions (Also listed above): 
 For incoming referrals, we will want programs to be able to select a referral source that is not currently in the OC Navigator
 Can/should we add incoming sources on the PEI Incoming Referral Form not in the OC Navigator? 

 Table: Referral Sources From the PEI Referral Form that are not in the OC Navigator 
 Group 
 Referral Source 
 Questions 

 Individual Community Member
 Family

 Friend

 Criminal Justice Organizations / Programs
 OC Probation Department

 OC Sheriff's Department

 Other law enforcement/police department

 Do we want the ability for users to select a global "Other" and then write in the referral source?

 Do we want to be more specific? Tim provided us a list since they wanted to record this for OC Links and CAT
 https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1PYpkmvlDv9H6UHJLUHgbjo6T1YFEloK6/edit#gid=2020676100 

 OC Courts
 Project Kinship

 AB109 Screeners

 Health / Medical Providers
 Medical Hospital / Emergency department

 FQHC

 Psychiatric Hospital

 Other Medical (specify type): __________________

 Do we want to be more specific with hospitals? Tim provided us a list since they wanted to record this for OC Links and CAT
 https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1PYpkmvlDv9H6UHJLUHgbjo6T1YFEloK6/edit#gid=2020676100 

 Crisis / Emergency Response
 988 / Crisis Hotline

 First Responder (other than law enforcement)

 Do we want to be more specific than First Responder?

 SUD Service Providers
 MHRS SUD Outpatient Services

 MHRS SUD Withdrawal Management Programs

 Community SUD Provider

 Do we want to be more specific for all three of these?

 Community and Social Service Departments
 School

 OCCR

 Veteran Services Organization

 Other (specify type): ___________________________

 Do we want to list the schools? Tim provided us a list since they wanted to record this for OC Links and CAT
 https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1PYpkmvlDv9H6UHJLUHgbjo6T1YFEloK6/edit#gid=2020676100 

 Do we want to list the Veteran Services?

 Other Referral Source
 Other PEI program

 Other CYS program

 Other AMHS program

 Other program (specify type): ____________________

 Statuses
 In order to accommodate the a large range of programs, we are setting up the following structure:
 Core statuses - common R&L statuses that will set the foundation for a shared method of tracking a referral's progress across the entire HCA ecosystem

 Program specific statuses - statuses that accommodate for the unique workflows of different programs. Examples include:
 Dispatch statuses

 Inpatient statuses (e.g., need to account for discharging a client)

 Core Statuses 
 https://www.figma.com/file/EprYbsNopmnathUoGWew7g/Statuses?type=whiteboard&node-id=0%3A1&t=N7wszxJoTTOueKwu-1 
 Status 
 Definition 
 Example 

 Requested 
 Program sends a referral to another program
 Doctor sends a referral to a Physical Therapist (PT)

 In Review 
 Program acknowledges receipt of referral and is in the process of determining whether the referral is a good fit for their program
 PT reviews referral 

 Accepted 
 For dispatch & residential programs - Program accepts the referral 
 For outpatient programs - Client is scheduled at program
 PT schedules the patient

 Not Accepted by Individual Program w/in Referral Group 
 Program declines the referral because they are at capacity, the referral could be better served by another program within their referral group, or the client said that they did not want to work with this specific program
 PT does not accept referral because they are at capacity but sends referral back to a pool to be reviewed by another program that offers PT

 Not Accepted for Referral Group 
 Program declines the referral because the client needs a higher level of care, lower level of care, is not eligible for services, or did not want to work with the referral group 
 PT does not accept referral because the client needs an X-ray before they can qualify for services

 Linked 
 For outpatient programs - Client attends the first appointment with the program
 For residential programs - client is admitted to the facility
 For dispatch programs - client has started first interaction 
 Patient attends first PT appt

 Not Linked 
 For outpatient programs - Client does not attends the first appointment with the program
 For residential programs - client is not admitted to the facility
 For dispatch programs - unable to start the interaction
 PT accepted the patient, but the patient never showed up for their first appt

 Discharged 
 For outpatient programs - Client has attended and left their first appointment
 For residential programs - Client is discharged from the center
 For dispatch programs - Interaction with client has ended. 
 PT leaves first PT appt

 Archived 
 Duplicate or test referral that can be closed
 PT archives referral because it's duplicative of another referral

 Program specific statuses
 Program 
 Add'l Statuses Needed 
 Modified Captions 
 Questions 

 CRP & CSU
 Admitted = Linked 

 OC Links
 Will OC Links receive referrals that they need to follow up on? 

 O&E 
 Triage Requested 
 Assigned 
 Dispatch Accepted 
 Start Interaction 
 End Interaction 
 Cleared 
 Triage Requested = Accepted
 Start Interaction = Linked
 Cleared = Discharged
 How do we define a linkage for O&E?
 Answered: when the outreach worker has begun the interaction with the client.

 CAT
 Dispatched
 Arrival
 Start Assessment
 End Assessment 
 Cleared
 Discharged = Cleared
 How do we define a linkage for CAT? When the assessment is cleared?

 Requirements
 Statuses 
 Accepted and Linked
 These are key statuses and time stamps to record. When a user moves beyond the statuses of accepted or linked, the fact that they were accepted or linked still needs to be documented
 ie: a referral doesn't stop being linked because someone was discharged

 Updating statuses
 Users should only see the statuses that are up next (ex: if a referral is in the status of "Accepted", then the only statuses available should be "Linked" and "Not Linked")

 Editing a status
 Users need ability to edit a status
 Date/time or reason can be edited easily

 Editing status will take user to a warning screen that all subsequent statuses will be overwritten 

 Users need ability to clear a status

 Current status
 At any point, OC will need to quickly identify the current status that a referral is in

 Reporting
 Number of referrals linked

 Number of referrals accepted

 Current status of all referrals

 Two distinct fields are needed 
 Need one field for referral status

 Need a separate field for program_status and that is the status that is applicable to the program

 Time stamps 
 All statuses need time stamps 

 OC wants ability to save and export multiple time stamps for a single status
 Ex: Referral is "Requested" > CRP A updates status to "In Review" > CRP A updates status to "Not Accepted by Program within Referral Group" > CRP A updates referral to "Requested"
 OC wants a time stamp for both times referral went to "Requested"

 OC needs to know when the 1st outgoing referral was requested, even if other outgoing referrals are later added
 Ex: Client goes to doctor > Doctor refers client to PT > PT doesn't accept referral > Doctor refers to X-ray
 OC cares about both outgoing referral requests and timestamps, but they really need to know when that very first referral to PT occurred

 R&L for Programs Outside of Chorus
 In progress

title: OC Access Management (for Zones) PRD ‚Äì¬†ABANDONED
content:
THIS SCOPE OF WORK WAS NEGATED AND SUPERSEDED BY THE IMPLEMENTATION OF OC SSO & User Provisioning PRD AS OF AUGUST 2023. 
 Chorus team 
 Responsible: 

 Accountable: 
 Katy Jeter, Product Manager

 Consulted: 
 Addie Nakatani

 Sarah Burdette

 Informed: 

 Jira epics 

 Figma file 
 DES-331 a9d3eb4c-c63a-3c77-864c-b5dd8664a020 System JIRA

 Client deadline 

 Objectives
 Approved Orange County staff members will have full control over the ability to manage users within their Chorus app, without requiring a support ticket submission to Chorus. We will create a client-friendly portal for OC Super Admins to manage Service Chiefs, and for Service Chiefs to manage Program Staff users, for access to their associated program(s) (i.e. their appropriate mobile zone(s)) in the Orange County app ecosystem. 
 Broader Context
 Currently, the Orange County team is submitting tickets via Zendesk whenever users needed to be added, removed, or edited from specific zones (via Client Groups). The key pain points we have with this approach:
 It is taking up SA resources that would be better spent working on active builds. 

 It is not always clear which users should have access to which zones.

 It is cluttering the Zendesk ticketing system with non-critical work.

 It is likely that because the OC admins do not have clear visibility into the existing list of users, there may be users that are no longer active or should be removed from the app.

 Terminology
 Term 
 Definition 

 Program
 A program within the Orange County HCA ecosystem.
 County-Operated Program Examples
 OC Links

 CAT (Crisis Assessment Team)

 O&E (Outreach & Engagement)

 UAF (UAF Surveys conducted by O&E)

 County-Contracted Program Examples
 OC Warmline

 CRPs (Crisis Residential Programs)

 CSUs (Crisis Stabilization Units)

 OC Super Admin (placeholder title)
 Client's term for a user with privileges to:
 Make another user a Service Chief

 Access a list of all existing users in OC

 Ability to add, edit, and remove OC users

 Service Chief (placeholder title)
 Client's term for a user with privileges to: 
 Access a list of existing users related to their program

 Ability to add, edit, and remove users from their program

 Program Staff (placeholder title)
 Client's term for a user with privileges to: 
 Access specific zones within the OC app

 Roles
 Client's term to differentiate staff member types. Depending on their Role, users will be assigned to different Client Groups, which have access to specific mobile zones.

 Modules
 Client's term for the different mobile zones within the OC Links app (app ID 2000).
 Note : In the case of Orange County, the different mobile zones are frequently (and incorrectly) also referred to as different "apps". 

 Key User Stories
 As a Service Chief, I can manage Program Staff users.

 As an OC Super Admin, I can manage Service Chief users.

 As a Program Staff user with a specific Role, I have access to the appropriate mobilized zone based on my associated Client Group.

 Critical User Journey(s)

 Portal for viewing a list of Program Staff users

 OC Super Admins
 Access to appropriate zones within the app (access to the highest number of zones)

 Portal for viewing a list of Program Staff users

 Portal for managing a list of Service Chief users

 No abilities to edit zones or change members of Client Groups.

 Program Staff Users
 Access to target zones (smallest number of zone access)

 Locked out of all other zones

 Success metrics
 Goal 
 Metric 

 Allow Orange County to self-manage their users
 Reduced number of Zendesk requests 

 Expedite the user provisioning process
 Reduced amount of time spent provisioning accounts

 Give better visibility into the list of existing users
 There will be a reduced number or more accurate list of users

 Constraints
 What compliance guidelines, budgetary/timeline restrictions, or other factors need to be kept in mind? 
 Requirements
 User Permissions
 Note the below role names are placeholders ‚Äì need to decide if this will use the client's language or if/what existing user roles we'll use to fulfill these needs. 
 OC Super Admins . Designated by Chorus Staff. These users can manage Service Chief and Program Staff users.

 Service Chiefs . Designated by OC Super Admins. These users can manage Program Staff users for their associated program.

 Ideas
 There are two approaches to consider: 
 Extend the existing functionality of the Admin Portal currently used by OC Super Admins (i.e. Tim and Sharon).

 Problems to solve
 At this time, there is not a response set available that can handle removing a user from a Client Group. We will need engineering to add this feature.

 Open Questions
 Question 
 Answer 
 Answerer

 Per our meeting with Sharon on 07/19, we may need to have SSO first and then apply access management once it has been implemented. We plan to have more internal and external meetings with HCA IT in the coming weeks to get this scoped out more.

title: üìÉ PEI Client Case Forms
content:
Please note: not all projects require a PRD; this template should be used to gather requirements for any track of work that will take more than one sprint to complete. 
 Chorus team 
 R esponsible 
 Designer: Ellie üé®

 Engineer / SA(s): Donovan, Christina üí™ üí™

 A ccountable
 Product Manager: Julie J. ü§ì

 C onsulted: Marya, Phoenix üß†
 I nformed: Phoenix, Armen üé©

 Jira epics 
 CP-3673 a9d3eb4c-c63a-3c77-864c-b5dd8664a020 System JIRA 

 Figma file 
 https://www.figma.com/file/HeRX8jmIv9lDTwTzCboSkb/PEI-CP-3673%2B?type=design&node-id=0%3A1&mode=design&t=8WSNCJg92HRV2zo7-1 

 Client impacts 
 Orange County contracted prevention and early intervention providers

 Chorus impacts 
 OC Links, OC Warmline, OC Navigator, O&E

 Client deadline 

 Terminology
 Term 
 Definition 

 OC HCA
 Orange County Health Care Agency, our client. Refers to the broader group and high-level stakeholders.

 PEI
 Prevention & Early Intervention: a funding source to provide preventative care for individuals with serious mental illness. Orange County Health Care Agency contracts with about 26 providers who are PEI-funded.

 PIF
 Participant Information Form: a document that captures the participant's basic and demographic information.

 Participant
 Often referred to as "client" in Chorus, but individuals receiving care from PEI programs are called "participants."

 Qualtrics
 A software that OC HCA and contracted service providers use for some documentation.

 Objective
 We will design and build a case/client management system with a thorough demographics form for 26 county-contracted service providers who provide PEI services. When complete, users will be able to receive incoming referrals, enroll participants, fill out the demographics form, discharge participants at the end of their care, and document referrals.
 Broader Context
 OC HCA has previously been managing these forms through Qualtrics, which was not meeting their needs. OC approached Chorus to build a better experience. There is also a referrals and linkages component that will come into play and is easier for Chorus to manage. 
 Personas
 User Class 
 Description 
 Key Goal 
 Control 
 Persona 

 Service Provider
 Entity that provides supportive services to individuals with a mental health need. 
 Record participant's basic & demographic information 

 Enrolls participant in services (if eligible) and records enrollment date

 Refers participant to additional supportive services if needed

 Discharges and provides 2 surveys to participant 

 Access to PIF

 Only their participants

 Denise
 Age: 42

 Occupation: Clinical social worker

 Education level: advanced degree

 Tech savvy: 7/10

 Participant 
 An individual with a mental health need who is referred (incl. self-referred) to a service provider and receives supportive services.
 Takes anonymous satisfaction survey (not in Chorus ‚Äì we will link to survey or send via SMS) 

 Takes perceived impact survey; feedback is tied to participant.

 Links to surveys will be provided to participant.

 Richard
 Tech savvy: 3/10

 OC HCA
 Someone at the county who provisions access to Chorus for county-contracted providers.
 Control access to Chorus forms & provision accounts for county-contracted providers 

 Administrator module

 Sharon 
 Tech savvy: 10/10

 Key User Stories
 User: Service Provider
 As a Service Provider, I want to fill out the Participant Information Form and log information as necessary so that the participant can receive care and the required data is collected. 

 User: Participant
 As a PEI participant, I want to fill out the anonymous satisfaction survey and perceived impact survey so that the provider can improve their services for me and future participants.

 User: OC HCA admin
 As an admin at the county, I want to control which service providers have access to which case management systems so that access is properly managed.

 As an admin at the county, I want to receive data specific to each PEI program on a monthly basis.

 Critical User Journey(s)
 User: Service Provider
 Participant is referred, or self refers, to the program. 

 Provider opens the form to collect basic and demographic information. 

 Provider enrolls the participant (based on eligibility criteria), documents enrollment date. 

 Provider refers the participant to supportive services ( e.g., food pantry, outpatient ) at any point in time. 

 Provider discharges participant. 

 There's one program - Working Wardrobe - that will need case notes and documentation. 

 User: Participant
 At the point of discharge, participant needs to take 2 surveys:
 Satisfaction survey in Qualtrics - this is anonymous and not attached to participant ID - isn't in Chorus. We link to the Qualtrics survey or send via SMS. 

 Perceived Impact questions ‚Äì needs to be attached to participant ID - it's a form with 8-9 statements and a Likert scale for responses. There are three versions: General, Older Adults, and Parenting. HCA will tell us which provider uses which form - each provider uses only one of the three. 
 Short-term HCA is asking providers to continue using paper format to collect this feedback since HCA doesn't know how participants would fill out the form technology-wise on site. 

 User: OC HCA Admin
 Admin provisions access to contracted providers via access management module.

 Admins receive data stored for each PEI provider.

 Constraints
 What compliance guidelines, budgetary/timeline restrictions, or other factors need to be kept in mind? 
 Need MVP solution by 
 To meet this deadline, we are targeting for release.

 Requirements
 Data
 Each PEI provider has it's own data table. Data should not cross between providers or other OC programs.

 Case Management System
 Dashboard 
 Participants need to be searchable by name and DOB as forms can be filled out/edited/modified during the duration of their care. 
 Basic info fields that are required in order to be searchable are name and DOB.

 Participant Information Form, Enrollment and Discharge
 We will use a standardized form across all programs (Warmline, O&E, etc.)
 Demographic questions have a specific logic (out of scope) 
 We may forgo implementing logic for ease of implementation and short timelines.

 Perceived Impact Form
 Needs to be attached to participant ID, so this will be filled out in Chorus.

 Form with 8-9 statements and a Likert scale for responses
 3 versions: General, Older Adults, and Parenting. HCA will tell us which provider uses which form - each provider uses only one of the three. 

 Participant Satisfaction Survey 
 Anonymously filled out in Qualtrics (a software the providers have access to). 
 This form will NOT be filled out in Chorus, but we will provide a way for the participant to access it. 
 We can do this via QR code, email, and/or SMS . (out of scope)

 Referrals and Linkages
 Providers can document referral to the type of supportive service available (e.g., outpatient services, food pantry) and manually confirm whether the participant accepted or declined the referral. Eventually, we'd need to roll out "closed-loop" feature where providers can refer to the specific organization but this will require HCA creating the hierarchy of resources for referral (this is currently underway via OC Navigator). 

 Role-Based Access
 Each provider needs only to see its own participants

 Each provider may have a different Perceived Impact form attached to the participant

 We'll need to provide HCA admins a way to do user account provisioning, since these are county-contracted providers who are not currently in Chorus. 

 Activity Log
 Time stamp all changes to participant information.
 This is for audit purposes only so just need to make sure we can trace the data from the backend. Does not need a place in the UI. 

 Data export required
 Frequency and fields tbd

title: CAT & Geotab Overview
ancestors: OC Improve Dispatch Response & Safety (Geotab) PRD
content:
CAT Pain Points 
 Improve Safety for dispatched staff in the field
 Knowing where they are located and how long they have been stopped can help to clue in program staff on the safety status of a dispatch clinician

 Improve the arrival time of CAT clinicians to clients in the field
 Due to state requirements, CAT needs to have a CAT clinician arrive to a client in the field 60 minutes after a caller has been identified as needing CAT assistance 
 MHRS goals is for CAT program to have 75% of clinician responses to arrive to the client in the field in 30 min or less
 this stat need to be verified

 the "clock" needs to begin immediately after CAT eligibility has been identified while on the phone, not after all the dispatch information has been collected 
 To account for this "clock start", program suggested the idea of the OC links operator having the ability to click a button after a client's CAT eligibility has been confirmed, that would start the "clock"

 Program & Sharon also suggested using the dispatch decision tree that Tim S is creating; once the decision tree leads to CAT program → YES, then an OC Links Operator could click the button to start the dispatch "clock"

 Known CAT Requirements Thus Far: 
 Ability to see location of CAT fleet vehicles in the field in real time

 Ability to know which CAT clinicians are associated with which fleet vehicles in real time

 Ability to distinguish the type of fleet vehicle in the field (ADA van vs other)

 Ability to change which individual CAT staff (not dispatch pairs) are associated with which fleet vehicles quickly and easily at any time that staff are in the field 

 CAT & Geotab Overview 
 5 CAT County Fleet Vehicles currently used
 CAT staff currently share the 5 vehicles and/or use their personal vehicles as needed
 The same CAT staff is not always associated with the same vehicle each time

 CAT Program will have 21 updated fleet vehicles by May 2024 at the earliest 
 These vehicles will have Geotab hardware integrated into them

 CAT clinician count is anticipated to grow 
 If clinicians are going out in pairs when the 21 vehicles are available, there still may not be enough vehicles to for all staff to be tracked in Fleet Vehicles 

 Clinicians may have to use their personal vehicles on occasion 

 Clinicians dispatched in pairs
 This pilot has already started, but is not implemented across the entire program currently 

 Staff association with fleet vehicles
 currently CAT does not associate staff with the same vehicle each time they're out in the field

 Current workflow is for staff to "check out" a fleet vehicle, they have to log which vehicle they are using each time

 Program Vehicle Tracking
 Program would like to account for union privacy needs by framing Geotab integration as the following
 Program must know which staff are using which county resources (which staff "check out" specific fleet vehicles)

 Program is tracking vehicle location not staff
 But because we know the vehicles check out by specific staff and we know the location of the specific vehicles, we can use that data to help coordinate dispatch and staff safety

 Vehicle Type and Staff Association
 They will have two ADA Vans 
 They may have a call that comes in that requires a staff who is associated with another car, to be transferred to the van or visa versa to better accommodate a client's needs 

 Next Steps & Questions to Account for: 
 Further Refine requirements 
 Map Feature Development and Options 

 Lay Out User Journeys 

 Develop a PRD 

 Staff Association 
 Fob and Reader?

 Cost?

 Scanning needed for association 

 Geotab Drive
 Can this data be integrated into a Chorus app so they don't have to log into Geotab drive & Chorus Aps?

 Program question: what budget is available for fob 

 How many vehicles will be associated with CAT program?

 When will CAT clinicians be moved to pairs?

 O&E staff may have more resistance to being tracked due to less urgency for response times for clients

 Next Steps: 
 Sarah will confirm with Phoenix desired milestones for implementation

 Sarah will schedule follow up call with Drake from Geotab
