title: PRD - Universal Referral Portal (Screenings and Transition)
content:
Chorus team 
 PM: Thai

 Project Manager: Mayra

 Design: Ellie

 Research: Angelina

 SAs: TBD

 QA: TBD

 Timeline 
 Launch by Q1

 Roadmap 
 TBD

 Jira epics 
 TBD

 Figma file 
 TBD

 Problem
 Complex referral pathways require multiple processes and steps for clients . This causes clients to get lost in the system without receiving care.

 Referrals require providers to send each other multiple back and forth communications , taking time away from client care.

 Delayed treatment per client results also results in higher costs related to poor clinical outcomes and readmissions 

 OC-specific issues:
 Currently, Chorus only supports referrals between OC programs.

 Programs outside of OC (Ex: CalOptima, Kaiser) drive high volume of referrals into OC.
 There also exists a high volume of referrals from OC programs to external programs (Ex: CalOptima and Kaiser MCPs)

 Personas
 Individual Clients
 Searches for and requests behavioral and mental health services 

 CalOptima Behavioral Health Coordinators
 Answers phone calls from Medi-cal beneficiaries and determine which level of care to send them to.

 Receives incoming transition of care referrals from OC and send them to contracted MCP providers

 ASO Coordinators
 Answers phone calls from OC clients and determine which level of care to send them to.

 Receives incoming referrals from CalOptima and send them to the correct provider

 Adult/Youth intake coordinator
 Manage incoming referral requests to OC MHP's and sends the client to the correct provider based on earliest availability

 Adult/Youth MHP provider
 Intake incoming referral requests from various sources to provide treatment

 Refer clients to MCP's when they need to transition to a lower level of care.

 Before we begin: a note on terminology
 Term 
 Definition 

 Referral
 The process of sending a client from one service provider to another service provider for health care, behavioral health services, and/or other support services, by electronic transmission, in writing, or on the phone, regardless of linkage status.

 Linkage
 When a client has attended at least one appointment or made one visit to the identified program(s) or services for which the client has received a referral.

 Resource Recommendation
 The process of providing a client with one or more suggested resources, without plans and/or an ability to follow up on Linkage status

 MCP 
 Managed Care Plans: In California, Medi-Cal covers mental health services through different delivery systems with non-specialty mental health services delivered by Medi-Cal Managed Care Health Plans (MCPs). In Orange County, these are managed by CalOptima and Kaiser.
 California requires MCPs to cover the following mental health services:
 Mental health evaluation and treatment (including individual, group, and family psychotherapy)

 Psychological and neurological testing, when clinically indicated to evaluate a mental health condition

 Outpatient services for the purposes of monitoring drug therapy

 Outpatient laboratory, drugs, supplies, and supplements

 Psychiatric consultation

 Dyadic care services.

 MHP 
 Mental Health Plans provided by the county. In California, Medi-Cal covers mental health services through different delivery systems with specialty mental health services delivered by MHP's. In Orange County, these are managed by OC BHS.
 Currently, specialty mental health services covered by MHPs in CA include:
 rehabilitative mental health services (which includes mental health, medication support, day treatment intensive, day rehabilitation, crisis intervention, crisis stabilization, adult residential treatment, crisis residential treatment, and psychiatric health facility services); 

 psychiatric inpatient hospital services

 targeted case management; 

 psychiatrist services; 

 psychologist services; ‚Ä¢ psychiatric nursing facility services; 

 EPSDT services (including intensive care coordination, intensive homebased services, therapeutic behavioral services, and therapeutic foster care); and 

 peer support services.

 Screening Tool
 Screening Tool - For Medi-Cal beneficiaries that are trying to receive mental health care for the first time 
 If the client scores high (>=6) on the Screening Tool they are sent to a OC HCA provider

 If the client scores (<6) on the Screening Tool they are sent to a CalOptima provider

 Transition of Care Tool
 Transition of Care Tool - For Medi-Cal beneficiaries that need to transition to a different level of care 
 After the client has meet with a provider and are ready to transition to a different level of care, then the Transition tool is completed and sent to the new provider

 CalOptima
 One of the two county organized health system that provides care for people who have Medi-cal. They provide manage MCP's in Orange County (along with Kaiser)

 ASO aka Carelon aka BAL
 Administrative Services Agency. Each county must have an administrative services organization, and Carelon is the ASO for OC BHS. BAL refers to one of the services that an ASO provides, which is a 24/7 Beneficiary Access Line. The ASO provides more than just this service however, as they also provides ongoing development and maintenance of the Mental Health Plan Network of Providers.

 CYS
 Children and Youth Services

 AOABH
 Adult and Older Adult Behavioral Health (AOABH)

 BHIN
 Behavioral Health Information Notice; statewide directive for standardizing services and processes for Mental Health & SUD service delivery

 Vision
 The overall aim for a universal referral portal is to support system-wide referrals and linkages throughout the entire OC network. 

 This includes the support for referral to and from external organization and eventually self referrals through a website navigator.

 Goals
 Ensure timely access to care for behavioral and mental health services to clients

 Reduce the administrative burden related to phone calls and data entry to support referrals

 note EQRO metrics to define timely access to services
 Non-urgent service rendered: 10 days

 EQRO metrics to define timely access to services
 Non-urgent service rendered: 10 days

 Success metrics
 Goal 
 Metric 

 Ensure timely access to care for behavioral and mental health services to clients
 Time from referral request to appointment offered

 Time from referral request to appointment accepted

 Time from referral request to linkage 

 No show rate

 Reduce the administrative burden related to phone calls and data entry to support referrals
 Reduce # of emails sent between MHP and MCP programs

 Reduce # of phone calls sent between MHP and MCP programs

 Staff satisfaction 

 Referral closure rate (rate in which referral is updated to linked/not linked/not accepted)

 Referral accepted rate

 Time from referral request to referral closure 

 Volume of referrals created in Chorus 

 User Research Synthesis
 3 Dedicated UXR sessions

 1 In-Person Shadowing

 1 Referrals and Linkages Workshop (OC kickoff)

 Ongoing design reviews done periodically

 Key Insights:
 Referral pathways can involve more than two programs

 Multiple referral pathways exist given multiple different scenarios

 End of referral destination isn't determined by the first referral source

 Contact attempts and appointments offered are necessary fields to complete for all services

 Functional Workflow - Future state
 https://www.figma.com/board/raU80x7EcQ0IYWtgKcZwJv/Universal-Referral-Portal---R%26L-Workflows?node-id=370-704&node-type=canvas&t=MBpWFDQwPXxObrf4-0 
 Feature Priorities
 Must Have Features 
 Feature 
 Justification 

 Referral Dashboards
 Users need a view to see incoming referrals to determine which they need to address

 Creating and forwarding new referrals
 Intake coordinators need the ability to create new referrals when requested from referral sources and send to different programs based on a variety of circumstances

 Attaching documents to referrals
 For all documents that are not digitized, file attachments allows for any relevant files to be passed along the multiple providers.

 Live Status Tracking
 Users need to see the history of the referral, including changes to status, notes from other providers, and linkage information.

 Support for screening tool
 All MCPs and MHP's require the use of a screening tool as required by DHCS.

 Support for Transition of Care tool
 All MCPs and MHP's require the use of a transition of care tool as required by DHCS.

 Record Contact Attempts and Offered Appointments
 The state requires reporting on offered appointments to measure timely access to care.

 Enabled Permissions per provider
 Referrals should be viewable by each provider

 Should Have Features 
 Feature 
 Justification 

 Clients Dashboard
 Not needed to support digitized referrals but allows users to search previous referrals by name.

 Client Referral History Page
 Not needed to support digitized referrals but allows users to check on referral history per client 

 Decision guidance for referrals
 Allows users full visibility of suggested referral guidance based on state requirements

 Email Notifications
 Allows programs to quickly respond to incoming referrals sent to their dashboard. Referrals can be supported without notifications but this requires users to view dashboard multiple times within a day.

 Nice to Have Features
 Feature 
 Justification 

 Print
 Allows users to have referrals documented outside of Chorus. Not crucial to current workflows found in UXR.

 Team Member page
 Allows providers to view team members on page and manually update their own profile.

 Future Roadmap (currently out of scope for initial launch)
 Feature 
 Justification 

 Integrated referrals and bedboards viewable directly on OC links, O&E, CAT, CRP/CSU
 Initial need is to ensure referrals between mental health clinics work properly in order to support MHP's and MCP's. Given high volume of referrals within MCP's and MHP's, this needs to be de-risked before connecting multiple applications with URP.

 Administrative/supervisor views
 Reports on referral tracking analytics as well as overview screens for multiple programs. 

 Guest portal
 Individual users can manually record incoming referrals which should account for any referral sources not added to URP. However, this needs to be a consideration once Kaiser needs to be added

 Kaiser MCP support
 Waiting on OC and Kaiser agreements to be finished

title: OC Resource Portal PRD (High Level)
content:
1 6 false default list true Chorus team 
 PM: Paul

 TPM: Katy

 Design: Allan

 SAs: Christina and Dylan

 Research: TBD

 Timeline 
 Launch by Q2 2025

 Roadmap 
 CLIENTRM-59 a9d3eb4c-c63a-3c77-864c-b5dd8664a020 System Jira 

 Jira epics 
 RNP-91 a9d3eb4c-c63a-3c77-864c-b5dd8664a020 System Jira 

 Figma file 
 https://www.figma.com/design/RMOWjHMQ6CH1gnxujIk3QG/OC-Nav-Resource-Portal 

 Link to original PRD 
 https://chorusapp.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/CHORUS/pages/edit-v2/2113339394 

 Before we begin: market-informed and data-driven
 Moving towards market-informed products 
 Current resource entry portal lacks best practices found among other resource publishing products on the market.

 Current Chorus resource entry portal
 Moving towards data-driven products 
 Chorus platform data for OC Navigator shows that most visitors are exploring resources as their first action. This supports the case for consistent resource entry and improving the resource interaction UX.

 Chorus Platform OC Navigator Data: April 7, 2022 - June, 11 2024
 Problem
 For Chorus: There isn't a consistent and simple resource management framework to offer up to clients purchasing a resource navigator. Chorus staff spend time supporting with resource management and product teams are generally starting from scratch identifying similar requirements for managing resource information. 
 For OC HCA: There isn't one simple and user friendly framework in place to manage OC resources used by various apps (OC Nav, OC Links, Warmline, CRP, R&L) leading to resource detail inconsistency and increased administrative time managing resources.
 Personas
 The following are general personas applicable to most resource navigators and can be adjusted as needed to align with the purpose of the app (e.g. demographics).
 Participants (End-Users): Individual looking for resources to get help for themselves or someone else.
 Goals: Easily find appropriate resources for themselves or people they're caring for.

 Motivations: To remain healthy or ensure someone they're taking care for is healthy

 Frustrations: Resource information may be inconsistent or inaccurate, leading to them not getting the help they need

 OC HCA County Administrator: Individual responsible for creating or updating resource information on behalf of their own organization/program
 Goals: Provide accurate, up-to-date, and consistent resource information for participants to engage with

 Motivations: Improve client care and reduce county's total health care costs

 Frustrations: Lack of central portal to manage resources leads to inconsistent resource information and increased administrative time to discuss resource governance

 Vision
 The OC Resource Portal streamlines resource management and powers applications across Orange County, ensuring consistent resource information, saving administrators time, and connecting communities to vital health resources.
 Additionally, a centralized resource portal will be critical to the development of self-referrals as the feature will rely on having a consistent resource framework in place for both client administrators and providers.
 Objectives
 Establish a simple resource management module that can be productized for resource navigators.

 Centralize resource management into a unified resource directory

 Reduce resource management time for both Chorus and client stakeholders

 Improve UX of OC Navigator resource artifacts (resource card & detail page)

 Success metrics
 Objectives 
 Metric 

 Centralize resource management into a unified resource directory
 Number of OC departments using the OC Resource Portal

 Reduce resource management time for both Chorus and client stakeholders
 Number of OC staff with access to the OC Resource Portal

 Reduction in communication between OC and Chorus regarding resource management and review

 Average time to create, approve, and publish resource (compare time between current resource portal and OC Resource Portal)

 Improve UX of OC Navigator resource artifacts
 Number of resources with consistent formatting and style

 User Research Synthesis
 While we've conducted user experience research for the OC Navigator, formal user experience research was not conducted prior to the design and development of the OC Resource Portal. While we were in contact with the client to receive feedback and approval for all of the resource portal designs, as we move towards templates, an opportunity exists for us to conduct more in-depth user experience research for future resource portal builds.
 Functional Workflow
 https://www.figma.com/design/RMOWjHMQ6CH1gnxujIk3QG/OC-Nav-Resource-Portal?node-id=5388-130419&node-type=frame&t=Y8oIe1qUZvDHTJsh-0 
 Feature Priorities
 OC Resource Portal user permissions are described here: https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1Q9-8K67iamXCeiOhiiU7v7rQO2I-50F7dZ4Rgs1wjkU/edit# 

 OC Resource Portal status use cases are described here: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1UQ4Xq721hlFp8ag6j_pDhOw1C1838dMQ9W0Yci8C7ks/edit?tab=t.0#heading=h.3ssl9c3zxydb 

 Content Style Guide designs: https://www.figma.com/design/iEY7EzLZAMPOmTud72voiR/OC-Nav-Content-Style-Guide?node-id=255-12626&node-type=frame&t=PJ6KF4zw7IdR958F-0 

 Must Have 
 Features 
 Description 

 Dashboard
 The Resource Entry Portal dashboard displays all available resources to users of the resource entry portal. It serves as their hub to be able to edit and review resource information that displays in the OC Navigator, OC Warmline and other Referrals and Linkages apps.

 Sidebar Navigation
 The Resource Entry Portal should have a sidebar that allows an Editor/Publisher to easily create a new resource, view all resources, and view resource submissions.

 Add Resource Workflow
 The Resource Entry Portal should allow for Editor/Publisher to add a new resource or edit an existing one. Editors submit this information for review, and Publishers can make resources live.

 Edit Resource Workflow
 The Resource Entry Portal should allow for Editor/Publisher to add a new resource or edit an existing one. Editors submit this information for review, and Publishers can make resources live.

 Preview Resource Workflow
 The Resource Entry Portal should allow for Editor/Publisher to preview a resource's desktop card, mobile card and detail page from the dashboard in multiple languages.

 Notifications
 Users will be notified through a notification when their submitted resource is rejected or if a resource is pending approval. Users will then have the option to review the rejected resource, edit the resource to correct the reasons why it was rejected, and submit it again for review.

 User Permissions
 Super Admin, Service Area Admin, and Program Group Admin should be able to control permissions for users with lower permissions in their group

 Updated Resource Detail Page
 Updated designs for the resource detail page when someone clicks on a resource on OC Navigator

 Updated Resource Detail Cards
 Updated desktop and mobile designs for the resource detail cards

 Should Have 
 Features 
 Description 

 Add Multiple Locations per Resource
 Users should be able to add multiple locations to a resource

 User Permission Control
 Super Admin, Service Area Admin, and Program Group Admin should be able to control permissions for users with lower permissions in their group. These admin should be able to log into the portal and manage permissions through a user permission control workflow

 Nice-To-Have 
 Features 
 Description 

 Online Resource Workflow
 Similar to how in-person resources are added, the similar flow should implemented add, edit, and preview online resources

title: OC Links & CAT Deep Dive
content:
üìá Contents
 6 1 false Summary|Contents|Quick reference list false Quick reference
 Chorus team 
 PM: Shane B.
 TPM: John M.
 PjM: Mike V.
 SA: Patrick 
 Design: Dan 
 QA: TBD

 Timeline 
 Originally launched in Jan 2021
 One of the first OC products launched

 Client Impact 

 Problem
 OC Links was created to replace manual, fragmented processes for managing service referrals and coordinating care that previously led to inefficiencies, lack of real-time data, and difficulty in tracking outcomes.
 Manual Processes: Prior to OC Links, OCHCA relied on traditional methods like phone calls, paper forms, and face-to-face referrals to connect individuals to services. These manual efforts were time-consuming, error-prone, and lacked the ability to track and monitor referral outcomes efficiently.

 Fragmented Systems: Service delivery was often siloed, with different departments or community-based organizations maintaining separate records or systems. This fragmentation created barriers to seamless coordination, follow-up, and integrated care.

 Lack of Real-Time Data: Without a centralized platform, it was difficult for OCHCA to access up-to-date information about service demand, client progress, and available resources, making it harder to make data-driven decisions or improve service delivery.

 Dispatch Board Before Chorus
 üó£Ô∏è Terminology
 You know what would be helpful when reading this doc? To know what all the words mean.
 Term/Abbreviation 
 Explanation 

 OC Links
 Resource for residents of Orange County, California, that connects individuals with mental health, substance use, and community services. It is part of the Orange County Behavioral Health Services and aims to provide a single point of contact for people seeking help or information about behavioral health resources, including mental health services, addiction recovery support, and community-based programs.

 CAT
 The CAT team refers to the Crisis Assessment Team and is part of the broader mental health and emergency response system. This team is specifically trained to provide immediate, on-site support for individuals experiencing mental health crises.

 Referral
 When a client is connected directly in writing to a specific service provider for care and treatment

 Recommendation
 When a client is verbally recommended and given more information about a specific service provider for care and treatment

 Objective
 Provide the OC Links team with the tools necessary to intake calls, create robust client profiles, and provide resources or create digital referrals to optimize resource allocation, ensure timely access to services, and create a centralized database of case and client history to ultimately improve overall client care.
 Digitize the Referral Process: Create a platform to automate and streamline service referrals, reducing manual efforts and ensure timely, accurate connections to resources.

 Centralize Data: Consolidate service information into a single system, giving OCHCA real-time insights into service utilization and outcomes.

 Improve Coordination and Follow-Up Process: Enable better tracking of client referrals, case / client history, and follow-ups to reduce gaps in client care.

 Increase Staff Satisfaction: Provide OC Links / CAT users with a tool that reduces time and frustration in their day to day process.

 üåé Broader Context
 OC Links, followed by CAT, was one of the first programs launched for the OC client in January 2021. OC Links is currently one of the main entry points into the OCHCA system of care where a call is received, triaged, and escalated to a direct referral, recommendation, or crisis dispatch.
 üßçPersonas
 OC Links Service Chief: Supervisor-level role within the OC Links program.
 Goals: View all cases at any time for supervisor level triaging and quality control. Oversee clinician rotation / assignment; monitor key outcomes / reporting

 Motivations: To ensure quality care, response times for clients, and efficient processes for internal teams, data visualization

 Frustrations: Resource constraints and efficiency, complex case management, and lack of visibility into higher level scope of cases across a specific time period

 OC Links Navigator: Individual responsible for fielding incoming calls and providing necessary resources 
 Goals: Provide accurate, up-to-date, and consistent resource information for clients to engage with to ensure a high level of care and timely response

 Motivations: Improve client care and reduce county's total health care costs

 Frustrations: Issues with resource management tools, such as cumbersome interfaces or manual efforts and difficulty in synchronizing data across multiple systems or platforms, duplicate data entry

 CAT Clinician: Accredited Individual going into the field to assess the severity of the crisis and determine the appropriate course of action to stabilize the individual
 Goals: Promptly provide care to clients experiencing a crisis

 Motivations: Improve end-user care and prevent crisis escalation

 Frustrations: Manual documentation including timestamps or notes; distractions from assessment due to process; difficulty communicating w/ dispatch

 CAT Dispatcher: Individual responsible for assigning and dispatching the most readily available clinician to cases as they come in
 Goals: Assess crisis acuity, gather pertinent information, and dispatch optimal team

 Motivations: Improve end-user care and provide prompt response to crisis situations

 Frustrations: Resource constraints and efficiency, outdated, manual, unreliable processes causing errors and delays, time pressures, and inconsistent resource navigation

 User Research Synthesis
 In person shadowing

 Ongoing design reviews and program check-ins

 CAT Shadowing 
 OC Links Shadowing - Aug 2 
 See previous research findings and workflow here: https://www.figma.com/board/JWoBZzV6MvJRNhgY9EdvwR/CAT-Dispatch-Workflows-June-2023?node-id=162-2119&t=5o1vwNMK5hZnMWsx-1 
 üîÄ Functional Workflow: Future State
 TBD 
 Success Metrics 
 Goal 
 Metric 

 Ensure timely response to triage requests and services for clients
 Reduction in time of the average case from baseline

 Time between dispatch request and accept status (Communication efficiency between agencies)

 Time between assignment and dispatched status (Dispatch efficiency)

 Time between accepted and arrival status (Dispatch efficiency)

 Time between unassigned and assigned status (Assignment efficiency and ability to select most readily available clinician(s))

 Time between accepted and arrival status (Dispatch efficiency)

 High program adoption and usage
 # of incoming referrals (cases)

 # of outgoing referrals

 # of dispatches

 Data integrity
 Reduction in # of duplicate clients over time

 Future Roadmap
 Objective: 
 Client feedback first - respond to immediate needs of the client to ensure success for the daily users of the application

 Build features in line with our template approach to create a best-in-class experience for case triage and crisis response

 Update OC Links and CAT to reflect recent learnings and improvements from both a UI and UX perspective 

 High Level Roadmap Items 
 Read-Only: Create a read-only experience for users who merely want to open a case to view without the risk of data overrides. Right now, every user is forced into an edit state causing data collision.
 Geotab / Geolocation Enablement : GPS enabled tracking of cases and clinician vehicles in order to optimize the dispatch process, provide real-time location information to users and clients, and ensure clinician safety in the field.
 Time Stamping (Case Details): Timestamp and show history whenever case details are updated 
 One of many future requests for an access log for case edits - seeing a similar request for other clients

 Updated CAT Dispatch Logic: Rethink and expand the current dispatch logic for crisis to support up to 4 clinicians, incremental dispatching (only dispatch one person at a time with notifications), tracking of role played in the case, and more.
 CAT Referral: Make a universal ability to create a referral at any time in CAT mobile because referrals are created at any time in the process.
 Rethink High Profile Client: Rethink the process of how the program defines a high profile client vs. a frequent caller to prepare for the automation of functionality in the system based on these flags.
 Next Up Clinician Rotation: Digitize the clinician assignment logic utilized by the program and incorporate into our application when assigning a clinician to a case. Also expand to support case queuing, prioritization, and flagging.
 Goals: 
 Provide the OC Links and CAT client with application and design updates that we've successfully implemented for other clients
 Improves data organization, organizes core workflow, and further optimizes crisis response which are all goals for the client

 Roadblocks: 
 There is currently a growing divergence between the OC product and what we are building for future clients (MOConnect) that is making what we create for OC very specific to this client and outdated 

 OC Links is a 24/7 application with no downtime and very little flexibility for training up on new features making updates difficult from a program level

 Potential Next Steps: 
 Decouple dispatch and case creation
 Most calls do not result in a crisis dispatch

 Will allow us to update each workflow and application separately and more easily in the future

 Implement NEW crisis dispatch workflow created for MOConnect / Merced
 Client search, intake, duplicate client check, assignment flow

 Update case creation and management workflow to replicate R&L, O&E, and other OC applications

 Create future features in unification with our growing template for case management and crisis response

 Opportunity: 
 There is currently a program shift in the OC Links and CAT programs with leadership changing, so this may be the perfect time to discuss these potential benefits and next steps with the client to build an updated roadmap for 2025+.

 We've previously valued OC Links as an area for R&D where we learn from the features built that translate to future clients. With this divergence, we're losing out on that R&D value because the features are less repeatable.
 We have an opportunity to get to a place where R&D in OC Links and CAT is valuable again starting with the steps above. 

 Requirements 
 See epics and related stories for most up-to-date details.
 Epics 

 https://chorusapp.atlassian.net/issues/WMB-77?jql=text%20~%20%22geotab%2A%22 

 Future epics will be added here as they are created.

 Program Specific Questions 
 See the Referral Information Form confluence page for all program specific questions.

title: NAMI OC Warmline PRD (High Level)
content:
1 6 false default list true Chorus team 
 PM: Paul

 TPM: Jason

 Design: Ellie

 SAs: Christy, Gio, Eric

 Research: TBD

 Timeline 
 Launched Q3 2024

 Roadmap 
 https://chorusapp.atlassian.net/jira/polaris/projects/CLIENTRM/ideas/view/4421349 

 Jira epics 
 WRKA-1016 a9d3eb4c-c63a-3c77-864c-b5dd8664a020 System Jira 

 Figma file 
 https://www.figma.com/design/NIVcHBRlLsJ6spfiRJ10ir/OC-Warmline%2FNAMI?t=eBBxsUkcLPCgWe3Q-0 

 Link to original PRD 
 https://chorusapp.atlassian.net/wiki/x/EwDWa 

 What are Warmlines?
 Warmlines are free and confidential communication services providing 24/7 emotional support to individuals experiencing mental health concerns, substance abuse, loneliness, or who are in need of community resources.
 Problems
 Warmline staff operations are manual and inefficient , relying on multiple softwares to manage staff, manage cases, and collect inbound communications

 Individuals may struggle to access 24/7 emotional support when needed, resulting in gaps of access to preventative care

 Individuals may also be limited in the variety of ways they can access emotional support which could result in an unwillingness to engage with organizations providing support

 Personas
 The following are general personas applicable to the OC Warmline.
 Participants (End-Users) 
 Goals: Find emotional support for themselves or someone they know.

 Warmline Administrators 
 Goals: Increase access to care for participants by improving operational efficiency of the Warmline organization

 Warmline Staff Supervisors 
 Goals: Maintain staff operations and ensure high staff satisfaction among peer support specialists

 Warmline Peer Support Specialists 
 Goals: Provide emotional support to participants interacting with the Warmline

 Vision
 The Chorus Warmline platform streamlines, augments, and simplifies staff operations, empowering peer support specialists to deliver both compassionate and efficient real-time support to individuals seeking emotional support.
 Objectives
 Our objective is to build a client/case management system to support OC Warmline staff with assessing callers, connecting them to resources, and improving team workflow. By doing this, we will:
 Increase Warmline operational efficiency

 Increase staff satisfaction

 Increase access to care for individuals seeking Warmline support 

 Success metrics
 Objectives 
 Metric 

 Increase Warmline operational efficiency
 Number of cases created per hour
 This value was 2.5 with iCarol, it went down to 1 with Chorus at launch, now currently at 2 again

 Increase staff satisfaction
 Number of Warmline administrators and staff reporting positive feelings about the Chorus platform

 Increase access to care
 Number of individuals served by the Warmline platform

 User Research Synthesis
 While we've conducted client feedback sessions and in-person shadowing for the development of the OC Warmline platform, formal user experience research was not conducted. Opportunity exists for us to conduct more in-depth user experience research for future Warmline developments.
 Functional Workflow
 https://www.figma.com/design/NIVcHBRlLsJ6spfiRJ10ir/OC-Warmline%2FNAMI?node-id=3689-118067&node-type=canvas&t=3SxyTRj1ta95gAa6-0 
 Feature Priorities
 Must Have 
 Features 
 Description 

 Login screens, dashboard view 
 Main Warmline platform where staff can log in and manage participant and case information

 Admin Portal
 Platform for Warmline admin to manage staff, send announcements, and view analytics dashboard

 Announcements
 Admin need to send announcements from the admin portal that are displayed to staff on the main platform

 Case Workflow
 Form and workflow to create, view, and edit cases of varying types of contact

 Participants
 Managing new and repeat participant information

 Live Chat and SMS
 Feature to provide a live chat and SMS based interface for staff to interact with individuals

 RingCentral Integration
 Integrating with RingCentral as our call center provider

 Resources
 Resource database for resources that can be recommended to individuals and added to their case

 Analytics dashboard
 Dashboard for admin track Warmline staff operations and case metrics

 Should Have 
 Features 
 Description 

 Merge Participant Workflow
 Allow administrators to merge duplicate participant profiles

 Live Chat/SMS Spam Prevention
 Flag and prevent incoming spam messages from reaching Warmline peer support specialist staff

 Nice-To-Have 
 Features 
 Description 

 Scheduling
 The ability to manage the schedules of their peer support specialist staff

 Post-Launch Features
 Feature 
 Justification 

 Reducing fields on the Participant and Case forms
 The length of the forms is adversely affecting the time it takes for staff to complete a case, staff satisfaction, and the page performance

 Merge participant workflow
 Staff have created multiple duplicate participant profiles resulting in duplicate data entry

 Resource search improvements
 Staff have expressed difficulty searching for the appropriate resource to recommend/add to a case

 Viewing last case created details when searching for existing participant
 Staff need to know details about a repeat participant when creating a new case for them to better understand how the participant can be supported

 Linking chat history to a case
 Staff are currently copying the chat log into the case details

 Block SMS spam numbers
 Admin and staff supervisors need the ability to block SMS spam numbers

 Next Steps
 Complete remaining NAMI OC Warmline contract items (fast-follow improvements and maintenance)

 Ensure we deliver a Warmline platform that meets baseline performance requirements

 Research Warmline GTM opportunity: https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/18MBjJjxSV3Zmcwc7jtT8ydMfCl6WyQInc2pzl1fo91U/edit#slide=id.g274b3ec297e_0_279

title: Pre-Petition Workflow
content:
User Story
 As a CARECourt user I want to be able to add monthly surveys before the client has had their official CARE petition in court because sometimes clients have to wait awhile for their court date. 
 Justification 
 Since the app is already built, we can't really start from scratch with this workflow

 All CLR apps are built with the assumption that we are creating a referral/case/petition object and attributing information to that object. There isn't a current build where we are adding information related to a referral/case/petition before that object is created. 

 This workflow is not for the majority of clients, its a fairly rare case but one that needs to be accommodated for anyways. Individuals who end up in "pre-petition" status are referrals from MIST, FIST or AOT. 

 To avoid a major overhaul, we're proposing to provide an option to bypass the required petition information until after the "pre-petition" phase is over (when client moves to "pending"). 
 Pros: 
 Able to add pre-petition information to client 

 Can attribute pre-petition information to fully filled out petition later 

 Quicker to implement 

 Keeps pre-petition information for separate petitions separate, should the client be re-entered into CARE program at a later time. 

 Trade-offs: 
 Can have multiple "empty" petitions (petitions with no case IDs) floating around if the client never makes it to their court date. 

 Wording doesn't really fit user's actual workflow (pre-petition insinuates that information is collected before the petition is even created) 

 Could have a more robust build for this but requires lots of dev time that we don't really have. 

 Open Questions: 
 What happens if client ghosts or disappears after pre-petition? Can we move to terminated without ever filling out the petition? 
 A: This is a scenario that can happen. They don't progress to another status type they just stop doing the petitions. 

 Workflow 
 Current Workflow 
 User clicks CTA to create new petition

 Users enters client information 
 Can be new client (PIF) 

 Can also be existing client 

 User enters petition information*
 Petition information is required to proceed
 Petition Case Number

 Original Petitioner

 CARE Petition Filing Date

 Date Court Ordered Investigation

 County Assigned to Investigate/Follow Client 

 User is taken to petition overview page where they can then add surveys to set petition status 

 Proposed Change - Add CTA to Petition Information page to bypass those required fields des 
 User clicks CTA to create new petition

 Users enters client information 
 Can be new client (PIF) 

 Can also be existing client 

 User sees the Petition Information page

 User clicks CTA for pre-petition flow

 Chorus creates empty petition shell 
 Shell has no case information or other petition data. 

 Chorus redirects user to petition details view page

 User clicks new monthly survey 
 User selects "pre-petition" status 

 User completes "pre-petition" survey

 Client moves into "pending" status (outside of Chorus)

 User adds new monthly survey to move client from "pre-petition" to "pending" 

 VALIDATION CHECK
 On new monthly survey flow, if Status = / = Pre-Petition
 AND petition does not have petition data (case ID) 
 Display petition information page and do not allow to progress until completed 

 CTA to bypass petition information is hidden when status = / = pre-petition

 Petition information: 
 Petition Case Number

 Original Petitioner

 CARE Petition Filing Date

 Date Court Ordered Investigation

 County Assigned to Investigate/Follow Client 

 Petitioner Information
 Name

 Number

 Email

 Upon completion of petition information, user is then taken to "pending" survey

 Client proceeds as normal through app. 

 The next time they fill out a "pending" or other survey, they will not need to fill out petition information if its already been completed. 

 Workflow Diagram 
 https://www.figma.com/board/Ax596jdSRNBFBI7pXQMMRn/Maddie-Sandbox?node-id=0-1&t=3hIDAfECUl4tfJv1-1 Requirements 
 User can bypass petition information screen on petition creation 
 CTA to bypass is only displayed on petition creation 

 If user clicks "edit petition information" at any other time, the CTA is hidden 

 When user clicks CTA to bypass petition information
 They are redirected to the petition overview and do not need to fill out petition information. 

 When user initiates new monthly survey and selected survey status = pre-petition
 User is navigated to pre-petition survey and can fill it out and complete it. 

 When user initiates new monthly survey and selected survey status = / = pre-petition
 user is forced to fill out petition information (case id etc.) 

 CTA to bypass is hidden 

 When user initiates new monthly survey and selected survey status = / = pre-petition
 and petition information is filled out 

 Then they don't see that screen anymore and proceed directly to their selected status's survey

title: Status Changes & Process Flow
content:
OC CARECourt has requested to change their statuses for the application. 
 Old Status 
 New Status & Cycle 
 Definition 

 (new status) 
 Pre-Petition 
 Monthly
 BHS has received the referral, petition has not been filed yet, and the court has not yet ordered an investigation. The minority of clients go through the pre-petition status; these are clients who are referred to CARE via MIST, FIST or AOT. 

 CARE Process Initiation
 Pending 
 Monthly
 Petition has been filed by BHS and/or the court has ordered an investigation. The majority of clients start their CARE journey in "Pending" status. 

 Dismissed (NRCS)
 Dismissed (Initiation) 
 Only Once
 Court has dismissed the petition and the client is not receiving services. 

 Dismissed (RCS) 
 (removed status) 
 N/A 

 Elective Client
 Elective Client 
 Monthly
 Court has dismissed the petition and the client is receiving services

 Active Agreement
 Active Agreement 
 Monthly
 Court approves the CARE agreement for the client

 Active Plan
 Active Plan 
 Monthly
 Court has ordered a CARE Plan for the client 

 Terminated
 Dismissed or Terminated (Active) 
 Only Once
 Client is an Elective Client or had an Active Agreement or Active Plan and has since stopped receiving county services. 

 Graduated
 Graduated 
 Monthly
 Client is an Elective Client, or has an Active Agreement or Active Plan and has opted to be graduated at their 1 year status hearing. 

 (new status) 
 Terminated (Follow-up) 
 Only Once
 Client was graduated and stopped receiving county services

title: Bed Census Dashboard
content:
User Story
 As a county manager or administrator, I want a way to see how many beds are filled at a provider's location at any given time so that I can manage bed availability within my county and get accurate reports on bed availability. 
 Description
 In Orange County, bed information is self reported by their residential Substance Use Disorder (SUD) providers. Within their SUD Residential System, there are four categories: perinatal, withdrawal management, recovery residences, and residential. Providers may offer one of these categories of treatment or multiple categories within their locations. Each category also has it's own bed management system where bed availability is reported to the county regularly, so the county can refer clients to these services. In order to manage beds effectively, bed boards need to provide specific information such what type of client can be placed within a bed, how long a bed is expected to be occupied, when each bed information was last updated (e.g., using timestamps), etc. 
 Requirements
 Management 
 View open and full beds for each provider at each location
 Timestamp of when bed board was last updated by the provider 

 Type of client that should be placed in the bed (e.g., ASAM score, gender, etc.)

 View how many clients at each facility were sent by ART

 Bed boards are arranged into three different populations: 
 Withdrawal management (WM) 

 Perinatal 

 Residential (RT)

 Recovery Residences (RR)

 To replace the slots (nice to have) 
 Future availability

 Gender

 Notes

 Providers
 Update bed counts 
 Full Beds

 Open Beds 

 Capture timestamp of when bed board was last updated 

 Provider admin can set total (max) number of beds for the facility

 Options

title: URP Re-Open Referral
ancestors: PRD - Universal Referral Portal (Screenings and Transition)
content:
User Story 
 As a supervisor, I want to be able to re-open "closed" referrals so that I can help fix mistakenly closed referrals without needing Chorus support to intervene. 
 Background 
 This is a client request. They have submitted 3 Zendesk tickets in a 2 week period asking for our team to reopen 20+ referrals. 
 Business Rules 
 This action is ONLY available for supervisor level users. 

 What is a "closed" status referral?
 Linked

 Not Linked

 Archived

 Not Accepted*
 This status is being deprecated 

 A "closed" status referral when being reopened needs to be be set to "requested" status only. 

 When reopening a referral, the re-opener must provide a reasoning. 

 Requirements 
 When a referral has been "closed":
 New CTA on referrals that are in statuses: 
 "Linked" 

 "Not Linked" 

 "Not Accepted" 

 "Archived"

 Reopen Referral CTA : user can change the status of the referral from a "Closed" status to "Requested" status 
 When this is completed, the status is updated to "Requested"

 Status panel shows an entry for the reopening with the provided reasoning

 Activity log reflects status change. 

 Supervisor must provide: 
 Reasoning

 Confirmation

 NOTE: this can only be performed by the last assigned program.

title: SUD Withdraw Referral
content:
User Story 
 As an ART clinician, I want to be able to withdraw referrals after they've been assigned so that I can place the client in a better suited treatment facility without having to involve contacting the treatment provider. 
 Business Rules 
 ART team needs to be able to "recall" or "withdraw" a referral that's been assigned to an RT provider, so that it is reassigned to ART
 Scenario: Sometimes ART will place a client and then a new bed will pop up that is better suited to the client. When this happens currently, ART has to contact the provider somehow (call or email) to return the client back to ART and then the provider also has to manually repost the intake slot that the client was assigned to. 

 The assigned intake slot for the client needs to auto release so that the provider doesn't have to re-enter it in the intake pool. 

 ONLY ART should have the ability to withdraw referrals. 

 Requirements 
 When a referral has been assigned to an intake slot and the destination for the referral is an RT provider AND Status is either Assigned Blue or Accepted Purple :
 ART Team Member can: 
 ACTION: Withdraw Referral
 ART clinician must provide a reasoning and note that they understand withdrawing the referral will release that client's intake slot at the provider's facility. 

 When this is completed:
 Referral destination is set to ART

 Source is set to the provider the client was assigned to

 Status is set to Approved Blue 

 Referral shows on ART team "Incoming" and "Pending" dashboards 

 New entry in status pane on referral details with timestamp, user who completed the withdrawal and reasoning. 

 Intake slot that the client was assigned to is released and reposted automatically to bed availability board. 
 Data remains the same (intake date/time, notes, gender, LOC, etc.) 

 The referral cannot be withdrawn if: 
 Referral Status is Admitted Green or Not Admitted Red 

 Providers cannot withdraw referrals, they should never have this action available to them.

title: Delivery Onboarding for New Providers & Programs (Contracted & Non-Contracted)
content:
Periodically, we are asked to onboard new providers and/or programs for various OC apps. While there may be some subtle differences between apps, the approach is generally the same.
 Overview
 Prepare user intake template 
 Create a copy of the User tab in https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1P2vrC-xYArFO13b9QyzeEeJSAQnDgIIu3iXnqL5jSPM/edit?gid=1959134824#gid=1959134824 .

 Update the "Role" column to be a dropdown list of valid options for that app.

 Send the template to the Delivery Manager.

 See https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1J20PtnrMjd8qFKmLyeclKb874Ine-wqDJmLi_bBNx-A/edit?gid=619086437#gid=619086437 if additional fields should be considered for initial intake
 Note: When users log in for the first time, we will collect that information during the app "registration" workflow.

 Prepare provider info intake template 
 Identify the specific app's variable for managing programs and create a template for fields needed from the client. (See tar_program as an example.)

 Send the template to the Delivery Manager.

 Request Group creation 
 Responsible Party: Delivery Manager

 Create a Client Group Name and send a request to OC IT and OC HCA IT to generate the needed Entra Groups.

 Based on the Client Group Name, identify the new zone URL and send this information along with the Entra Group names to the client to submit a NAR to OC IT/OC HCA IT for adding users.

 Configure the zones, AFs, etc. 
 Responsible Party: SD team

 Technical steps to get the new provider/program access to the Chorus app.

 Update Zendesk articles 
 Responsible Party: Customer Success

 Update any impacted Zendesk article related to provider/program directories.

 Notify the client the provider/program is ready to access 
 Responsible Party: Delivery Manager

 Notify client the work is complete, NARs are ready to submit, and zones are fully functional.

 Sample Provider/Program Creation with All Technical Steps
 https://chorusapp.atlassian.net/browse/WRKA-3552
